As the journey wears on and the rhetoric wears thin, Charlie can't help but poke holes in the pious disregard this storied sanctuary has for outsiders like herself‚Äîand her fellow camper, Sydney.

As the Crow Flies is a Stonewall Honor Book, and is the first volume in a series!

options.name: New Worlds
options.desc:
Combining twenty-four different science fiction and fantasy stories by twenty-four different creative teams, this anthology comic focuses on culture clash, exploring what happens when difference civilizations, worlds, and species meet. These are stories of discovery, conflict, communication, misunderstanding, and exploitation. It revels in the wonder of the new, but reminds us that one person's adventure can be a whole community's tragedy.

Contributors to new world include award-winning creators like Carla Speed McNeil, comics veterans such as Matt Howarth, internet superstars like Zach Weinersmith, and fresh voices like Blue Delliquanti.

options.name: Rice Boy
options.desc: Rice Boy is a surreal fantasy graphic novel set in a world called Overside. A lonely creature called Rice Boy and an ageless machine called The One Electronic venture through a strange world to fulfill a prophecy with implications few understand.

gone.name: Sleeping Wizards Book Early Bird Inter
gone.desc:
A paperback copy of Sleeping Wizards, plus the DRM-free, PDF ebook edition for no extra charge!

Shipping for this tier is DISCOUNTED. NON-U.S. ADDRESSES ONLY.

International shipping is estimated to range from around $19 for Canada, to $21 for everywhere else outside the United States. Early Bird backers will likely enjoy a discount equal to half the title's cover price.

These amounts are subject to change; estimates are not guarantees. Shipping rates are out of our direct control. Shipping charges will be collected after the conclusion of the crowdfund. Physical rewards will be shipped via USPS, and will not be sent to countries not served by that carrier.

options.name: One-Shot Adventure
options.desc: A special adventure created by the team behind Sleeping Wizards! This is a scenario for the 5th edition of the world's most popular TTRPG, and is set in the Shrine of Dreams from this comic!

options.name: Last Dance PDF
options.desc:
Miriam has trained her whole life to fulfill her dreams, and it's finally paid off now that she's the prima ballerina of the Lulli Dance Company. But she's been keeping a secret from them.

The years of sprains, fractures, and bruises have been taking their toll, and a catastrophic ankle injury now means one terrible thing: she has to give it all up forever.

Distraught beyond consolation, Miriam runs from the studio and discovers a secret room she's never seen before. Inside she finds a pair of gleaming white and gold slippers, and a mysterious voice whispering to her in the dark.

If she tries on the slippers, it says, she'll regain the strength to rise en pointe.

It speaks the truth! Soon, Miriam is back, but each achievement on her journey back means more negotiation with the spirit who claims it wants just one harmless thing in return . . . to join the ballerinas and dance, just like her.

options.name: The Lucky Poor PDF
options.desc:
Mazie's family has been offered a fantastic gift: their very own, brand-new house, built for them by Habitat for Humanity. But it's a present that comes with a number of strings attached, and soon, they'll learn just how many problems even a new home can't fix.

An inside look at inequality and second chances, struggle and hope, hard work and charity, The Lucky Poor is the incredible true story of one life-changing event, and every unexpected thing that happens next.

options.name: Real Hero Shit PDF
options.desc:
People are going missing in a small mountain town. The city guard are blocked from a real investigation. The notorious Underguild has assigned Michel a secret mission: find the missing villagers and bring whatever kidnapped them to justice. Unfortunately for Michel (and his fellow adventurers, Ani and Hocus), they‚Äôre short a fighter and need one more party member to foil this plot. Even more unfortunately, the only volunteer seems to be the arrogant, ostentatious, purple playboy Prince Eugene looking to cure his boredom. Covert is not a concept that he‚Äôs familiar with, and let‚Äôs just say his commitment to the mission is questionable.

Every day is basically spring break for Eugene, but outside the palace walls he crashes into a hard reality: the system that kept him safe in his silk-sheeted bed isn't particularly concerned with the well-being of anyone who isn't him. Eugene will have to level-up his awareness if he means to be a real hero, and time is running short!

options.name: The Inscrutable Doctor Baer PDF
options.desc:
While he‚Äôs much too busy to embark on any adventures himself, Dr. Baer is here to help with yours. Are you burdened with an unwanted magical object? Gorgon's head? Monkey's paw? FLAMING SWORD?! Sell it to Dr. Baer; he'll tame its spirit, carefully catalog its origin, and keep it safe and orderly within the walls of the spookiest house you're ever likely to find. 

But when novice explorers Taft the Tortoise and Pickles the Pig accidentally enable the theft of Baer's most powerful artifact by the nefarious sorcerer Gallus Lugubrious, the good doctor is forced out of his house to reclaim it. The only problem is, for everything he knows about magic, he knows nothing about adventuring, and he‚Äôll have to figure this one out as he goes, far from the comforting safety of home. 

In over his head, along with his equally inexperienced new allies, Dr. Baer sets out on a dangerous quest through a world of monsters and magic to set things right . . . and to find his next chapter.

options.name: Banned Book Club PDF
options.desc:
It's 1983 during South Korea's Fifth Republic, a military regime that has entrenched its power through censorship, torture, and the murder of protesters. In this charged political climate, a freshman named Kim Hyun Sook seeks refuge in the comfort of books. When the handsome young editor of the school newspaper invites her to his reading group, she expects to talk about Moby Dick, Hamlet, and The Scarlet Letter. Instead, she finds herself hiding in a basement as the youngest member of an underground banned book club. And as Hyun Sook soon discovers, in a totalitarian regime, the delights of discovering great works of illicit literature are quickly overshadowed by fear and violence.

In BANNED BOOK CLUB, Hyun Sook shares her dramatic true story of political strife, fear-mongering, the death of democratic institutions, and the relentless rebellion of reading.

options.name: The Chancellor and the Citadel PDF
options.desc:
The world is over. All that remains is the Citadel, and the Chancellor who protects it from the hostility beyond its walls. But what can she do when a fearful and angry mob is convinced she brought the world to ruin in the first place, and are determined to make her pay for it by destroying the one bastion of hope the world has left?

In her dramatic, richly imagined graphic novel debut, cartoonist Maria Frantz has created a brisk fantasy tale about the fears that lead to war, and the bonds that can keep a stronghold standing against the darkness.

options.name: The Lizard Prince PDF
options.desc:
Cursed princes, haunted rivers, fanciful pineapple wishes, and a fateful nighttime visit from a legendary sorcerer‚Äîthese are just a few of the ancient tales whispered in the forests of South America, retold in this beautifully drawn comics treasury!

This sixth volume of the ‚ÄúCautionary Fables & Fairytales‚Äù anthology series features modern takes on folklore from across the continent, for a wide-ranging fireside collection of thrills and spooky chills. Featuring the work of SHADIA AMIN, CONI YOVANINIZ, VEROÃÅNICA ALVARADO, and more!

options.name: The Night Marchers PDF
options.desc:
Ghostly warriors, angry gods, and monstrous tyrants? That's just the start of this collection of folklore from the Pacific, retold in comic form.

This fourth volume of the Cautionary Fables & Fairytales graphic anthology series is a thrilling, funny and totally unexpected take on stories spanning the entirety of the Pacific Ocean, with loads of lesser known myths and legends from the Philippines, New Zealand, Hawaii, and beyond.

options.name: The Nixie of the Mill-Pond PDF
options.desc:
Giant beanstalks, trickster cats, magic pipers, royal werewolves, marauding trolls, and wooden battle spoons? You may think you know where these are going but take another look; your favorite European folktales are refreshed, rebooted, and totally reimagined in this high-spirited and hilarious comics collection!

This third volume of the "Cautionary Fables and Fairytales" graphic novel series is a wildly unexpected romp through some of Europe‚Äôs most famous fables and lesser known favorites, spanning the realm from sly humor to dark fireside tales and everything in between. Featuring the work of CARLA SPEED McNEIL, MARY CAGLE, K.C. GREEN, KATIE SHANAHAN, and more!

options.name: The Girl Who Married a Skull PDF
options.desc:
Have you heard the one about the skull who borrowed body parts to pass himself off as a human so he could trick the village beauty into marriage? No? Well, what about when the daughters of Frog and Snake had a playdate? Okay, fine. But surely you've heard the story of the crocodiles who voted on whether or not to eat a man that had saved one of their lives? NO? Wow, have we got some stories for you!

In this vibrant comics treasury, some of storytelling‚Äôs finest talents reimagine classic African folktales with a modern twist. Funny, warm, and wildly inventive, these timeless tales are brand new all over again. Featuring the work of JARRETT WILLIAMS, CARLA SPEED MCNEIL, CHRIS SCHWEIZER, FAITH ERIN HICKS, and many more!

options.name: Tamamo the Fox Maiden PDF
options.desc:
Vengeful spirits, flying ogres, helpful teapots, and trickster tigers? That's just the start of this lively collection of Asian folktales, reimagined and retold in comics!

This second volume of the Cautionary Fables & Fairy Tales graphic novel series is a thrilling, funny, and totally unexpected take on stories spanning the entirety of the Asian continent, with loads of lesser-known myths and legends from Tibet, India, Indonesia, and beyond.

options.name: The Woman in the Woods PDF
options.desc:
Loup Garrou, mischievous rabbits, and spirits with names that can‚Äôt be spoken? That's just the start of this collection of folklore from the native tribes of North America, retold in comic form.

This fifth volume of the Cautionary Fables & Fairytales graphic anthology series is a thrilling, funny and totally unexpected take on stories spanning the North American continent. Tales form the Pacific northwest, the great plains, the southwest, and east coast.

options.name: Hex Americana PDF
options.desc:
Ken Takamoto is a wannabe racer stuck at home for the summer, with only his mother for company. Dante Willow is a ghost stuck in the car he crashed while racing his rival twenty years ago.

When they meet by chance, Ken has the answer to both their problems: enter the local racing league Hex Americana and win the annual Grand Prix. If they win, Dante can pass on to the afterlife and Ken can keep Dante's fixed-up car to go anywhere he wants. What starts as a simple plan becomes a wild summer full of witches, gnomes, feelings, magical chickens, and more as they prepare for the big race.

Will Ken and Dante finish first? Can they even make it to the finish line? And more importantly, what happens when this racing duo blooms into something more?

Bursting to the brim with crazy monsters, blazing automotive action, deep-rooted mysteries, and small-town secrets, HEX AMERICANA is the race everyone‚Äôs dying to win!

options.name: The Harrowing of Hell PDF
options.desc:
Over the thousands of years since Christ‚Äôs Crucifixion, the original gospels detailing his life and death have been edited, sanded down, and molded into the tale millions of people know by heart today. But what if that first fevered, dreamlike writing about this moment of profound historical upheaval were to be resurrected itself, brought back to life in a haunting fable for our modern age? THE HARROWING OF HELL is a revolutionary vision of a dying man‚Äôs descent into the darkness to save humanity from all manner of jailers.

In a richly symbolic, densely illustrated allegorical tale that echoes back to us from ancient times, EVAN DAHM reinterprets one of the most important religious figures in history, before the was the god of the wealthy and powerful, before he was recast as the warrior worshipers preferred.

options.name: It's Your Funeral PDF
options.desc:
Marnie Winters was going to turn her life around; get out of the house, make friends, no more ‚ÄúMiserable Old Marnie!‚Äù Everything was going to plan, but then, of course, she died. Now, Marnie‚Äôs a ghost trapped on Earth, and the only one who can help her is the overenthusiastic, alien social worker, Xel, whose job is to help ghosts ‚Äúclose their file‚Äù and pass on. Are you ready for a sweetly nostalgic trip through Marnie‚Äôs life, correcting mistakes and righting what once went wrong? Well sorry, this isn‚Äôt that story! Xel has a much better idea to soothe Marnie‚Äôs troubled spirit: an internship in the hopeless bureaucracy of the trans-dimensional Department of Spectral Affairs!

This new do-gooder duo has their work cut out for them in a series of hilarious mishaps and misadventures throughout the space-time continuum (but mostly in and around the office) as Marnie finds pathways through her feelings of worthlessness by helping others.

options.name: The Last Delivery PDF
options.desc:
A phantasmagoric dark fantasy unlike anything you‚Äôve ever explored before, from the wild imagination behind RICE BOY & THE HARROWING OF HELL.

An anonymous parcel delivery boy arrives at a sprawling and chaotic mansion, in search of a Resident who must sign for the package he bears. But this task grows into a horrible odyssey.

The vast mansion hosts an endless, frenzied party, and its revelers impede his every step. As his quest takes him deeper into the dripping, black bowels of the labyrinthine house, his mission grows into his single purpose for existence, and his determination to find the Resident may prove to be his undoing.

options.name: Mage and the Endless Unknown PDF
options.desc:
Peek through the leaves, beyond the clouded mountains, and you will find a garden with a strange attendant and an even stranger purpose. A young mage, asleep in a meadow, wakes to delights and fanciful spells that open a door to unknown wonder. Then, they eagerly step through to find only horror and death. There is no swashbuckling adventure in store; this world means them cold and deadly harm, and they‚Äôll need all their resilience, wit, and magic to push it back.

Gaze through fascinating silent windows into a terrifying dimension and follow the wordless Mage and their companions as they travel a shadowy fantastical land of monsters. Will they survive this endlessly curious mystery, or will the unforgiving darkness swallow them whole?

options.name: The Poorcraft Cookbook PDF
options.desc:
The Poorcraft series is the essential comic book guide to practical urban and suburban frugality! Whether you're new to independent living, a recent college graduate, or just downshifting to a simpler lifestyle, Poorcraft comics can help you with everything from finding a home to finding a hobby, dinner to debt relief, education to entertainment.

We've shown you how to live better, travel better, and now . . . learn how to eat better on the cheap with The Poorcraft Cookbook. This comprehensive guide features tips and tricks for vegetarian and vegan meals, cocktails, budget food shopping, kitchen equipment ideas, and loads of delightfully illustrated recipes from around the world.

options.name: Radium Girls PDF
options.desc:
It‚Äôs 1918 in Orange, New Jersey, and everyone knows the ‚ÄúGhost Girls.‚Äù

The proud holders of well-paying jobs at the local watch factory, these working-class young women gain their nickname from the fine dusting of glowing, radioactive powder that clings to their clothes after every shift painting watch dials. The soft, greenish glow even stains their lips and tongues, which they use to point the fine brushes used in their work. It‚Äôs perfectly harmless . . . or so claims the watch manufacturer.

When teeth start falling out, followed by jawbones, the dial painters become the unprepared vanguard on the frontlines of the burgeoning workers‚Äô rights movement. Desperate for compensation and acknowledgement from the company that has doomed them, the Ghost Girls must fight, not just for their own lives but the future of every woman to follow them.

A stunning graphic novel retelling of the shocking and inspiring true story.

options.name: Stars, Hide Your Fire PDF
options.desc:
Think of the future.

You excited?

You scared?

You excited and scared?

Andrea and Darra have just started high school in their dead-end Massachusetts hometown with no clear idea of life after graduation. But a chance encounter with a spirit named Carmen promises to make sure their future is bright. However, a strange boy named Liam warns the magic comes at a price. Now the future they want is in reach, but are they willing to sacrifice their friendship?

options.name: The Sea in You PDF
options.desc:
15-year-old Corinth was just trying to clean up the beach; she never expected to meet a mermaid, let alone be nearly drowned by one. It was the start of a very strange friendship!

After Skylla, the deadly fanged mermaid, mysteriously lets Corinth live, they grow closer through a cautious exchange of stories, gifts, jokes, and sign language. Mermaids, it turns out, eat people, but however terrifying Skylla may look, she‚Äôs a little younger, a little smaller, and perhaps a little too soft for all that. Bewitched by Corinth and their growing bond, she learns about all the best things in life on land: books, burgers, donuts, and this strange chattering human sound called laughter. But a storm is brewing‚Äîboth at sea and in Corinth‚Äôs increasingly dangerous relationship with her obsessively jealous boyfriend‚Äîand a magical bargain may be the only thing that can save her, at a tremendous cost.

options.name: Student Ambassador: The Silver City PDF
options.desc:
The ex-president has an international incident that only a younger version of him can solve! he needs... a student ambassador!

When former president Tex Olman, impressed by Joseph and his creative problem-solving, asks for his help on a trip to Mexico, it‚Äôs a dream come true. Not only does he have the adventure itch, Joseph has always wanted to learn more about his ancestral roots in the vibrant, ancient city of Zacatecas. But this vacation isn‚Äôt all churros and museums (though it does have those!). There‚Äôs a legend that ghosts haunt the city‚Äôs famous silver mines, and it‚Äôs starting to seem like more than just a story! Joseph will need his deep knowledge, knack for friendship, and adventurous mettle to decode secret messages, explore dangerous caves, and save the city‚Ä¶ that is,  if the Ghosts of Zacatecas don‚Äôt get him first! Student Ambassador is a globe-trotting action-adventure set in the real world where dangers mount, the stakes are high, and smarts save the day!

options.name: Student Ambassador: Missing Dragon PDF
options.desc:
When eight-year-old student ambassador Joseph Bazan wins a photo op with the President of the United States, he doesn‚Äôt quite know what to expect, but it certainly isn‚Äôt hanging out with the leader of the free world in a secret compartment inside the resolute desk! Joseph‚Äôs pluck and kid logic not only charm the president, but they soon help resolve a thorny trade dispute. This gives POTUS an idea. Across the ocean, eight-year-old boy king Nang Nukatau III has taken his father's crown and clumsily stumbled into an international incident, and now Joseph‚Äôs got a pressing mission: talk the tiny dictator back from the brink of war!

The diplomatic slumber party soon goes from awkward to scary as the castle is stormed and the boys are lost across South Korea and Japan where they have to outrun bad guys, learn to read Hangul, unravel the riddle of Gyeongbok Palace, break out of an abandoned bathhouse, befriend an army of snow monkeys, and crack the Case of the Missing Dragon!

options.name: Indiginerds PDF
options.desc:
First Nations culture is living, vibrant, and evolving‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶and generations of Indigenous kids have grown up with pop culture creeping inexorably into our lives. From gaming to social media, pirate radio to garage bands, Star Trek to D&D, and missed connections at the pow wow, Indigenous culture is so much more than how it‚Äôs usually portrayed. These comics are here  to celebrate those stories!

Featuring an all-Indigenous creative team, INDIGINERDS is an exhilarating anthology collecting 11 stories about Indigenous people balancing traditional ways of knowing with modern pop culture.

options.name: Patience & Esther PDF
options.desc:
Patience is a kindhearted country girl, eking out a living in Edwardian England as tremors of social change rock the world around her. When she starts her employment in formal service on the grounds of an opulent country manor, she has no idea that her own personal revolution is about to begin.

Selfless, dutiful, and just a touch naive, she takes to both her place as a parlor maid and to her new roommate, the bookish and progressive lady‚Äôs maid, Esther. In another time, the two women would have kept one another‚Äôs company forever in their little attic bedroom, living out their days in the employ of a Lord. But it‚Äôs now the dawn of a new age. The expanding empire has brought with it not only plundered wealth, but worldliness and new ideas. Suffragists agitate in the street, idle-rich bohemians challenge sexual mores, and Patience and Esther slowly come to realize the world is wider and full of more adventure and opportunity than they ever imagined.

options.name: YOU DIED PDF
options.desc:
DEATH awaits us all.

Really, it's the one thing we all have in common. But that doesn't make it easy to talk about. None of us can agree on what happens after the end comes, how much we should think about it beforehand, or even what death should mean to the living. And these questions make a lot of folks uncomfortable. So, let's get into it!

This anthology features an introduction by death positivity movement pioneer and activist mortician Caitlin Doughty, and a murderers' row of comics talent‚Äîincluding Raina Telgemeier, Shae Beagle, and Lisa Sterle‚Äîrelating their favorite stories, myths, hopes, and suspicions about death, dying, and even The Great Beyond.

options.name: Last Dance
options.desc:
Miriam has trained her whole life to fulfill her dreams, and it's finally paid off now that she's the prima ballerina of the Lulli Dance Company. But she's been keeping a secret from them.

options.name: The Last Halloween PDF
options.desc:
For every human on Earth, there is a monster connected to them.

Now, the barrier keeping them out of the human world is has been broken, and they‚Äôre all loose, wreaking havoc across the planet.

Chased out into the Halloween night, 10-year-old Mona meets some very strange new friends: a ghoul, a vampire, and her own monster. Together, they search for the only human who can restore the barrier, save the world, and keep this from being the Last Halloween.

options.name: Penultimate Quest PDF
options.desc:
Far across the Western Ocean on a mist-shrouded island guarded by giant sea monsters, heroes come to explore the mysterious dungeons that lie below the surface. None have yet to reach the bottom and return to tell the tale. Each party gathers daily for a new round of potion-making, sword-sharpening, armor-buying, and dungeon-crawling, and after hours of leveling up in dangerous battles with monstrous creatures from the depths, they rest and try again the next day when everything repeats. That is, until one adventurer stops to ask why. Is it endlessly exciting, or simply endless?

In a witty, genre-defying tale of magic, mystery, and philosophy, brave warriors must learn the difference between diversion and escape as they try to break the cycle of a penultimate quest in which the final fantasy never arrives.

options.desc:

Have you heard the one about the skull who borrowed body parts to pass himself off as a human so he could trick the village beauty into marriage? No? Well, what about when the daughters of Frog and Snake had a playdate? Okay, fine. But surely you've heard the story of the crocodiles who voted on whether or not to eat a man that had saved one of their lives? NO? Wow, have we got some stories for you!

In this vibrant comics treasury, some of storytelling‚Äôs finest talents reimagine classic African folktales with a modern twist. Funny, warm, and wildly inventive, these timeless tales are brand new all over again. Featuring the work of JARRETT WILLIAMS, CARLA SPEED MCNEIL, CHRIS SCHWEIZER, FAITH ERIN HICKS, and many more!

options.name: Tamamo the Fox Maiden
options.desc:
Vengeful spirits, flying ogres, helpful teapots, ghost pepper ghosts, and trickster tigers? That‚Äôs just the start of this lively collection of Asian folktales, reimagined and retold in comics!

This second volume of the "Cautionary Fables and Fairy Tales" graphic novel series is a thrilling, funny, and totally unexpected take on stories spanning the entirety of the Asian continent, with loads of lesser-known myths and legends from Tibet, India, Indonesia, and beyond. Featuring the work of GENE LUEN YANG, NICK DRAGOTTA, BLUE DELLIQUANTI, CARLA SPEED MCNEIL, NINA MATSUMOTO, and many more!

options.name: The Woman in the Woods
options.desc:
Loup Garrou, mischievous rabbits, and spirits with names that can‚Äôt be spoken? That's just the start of this collection of folklore from the native tribes of North America, retold in comic form.

This fifth volume of the Cautionary Fables & Fairytales graphic anthology series is a thrilling, funny and totally unexpected take on stories spanning the North American continent. Tales form the Pacific northwest, the great plains, the southwest, and east coast.

options.name: Hex Americana
options.desc:
Ken Takamoto is a wannabe racer stuck at home for the summer, with only his mother for company. Dante Willow is a ghost stuck in the car he crashed while racing his rival twenty years ago.

When they meet by chance, Ken has the answer to both their problems: enter the local racing league Hex Americana and win the annual Grand Prix. If they win, Dante can pass on to the afterlife and Ken can keep Dante's fixed-up car to go anywhere he wants. What starts as a simple plan becomes a wild summer full of witches, gnomes, feelings, magical chickens, and more as they prepare for the big race.

Will Ken and Dante finish first? Can they even make it to the finish line? And more importantly, what happens when this racing duo blooms into something more?

Bursting to the brim with crazy monsters, blazing automotive action, deep-rooted mysteries, and small-town secrets, HEX AMERICANA is the race everyone‚Äôs dying to win!

options.name: The Harrowing of Hell
options.desc:
Over the thousands of years since Christ‚Äôs Crucifixion, the original gospels detailing his life and death have been edited, sanded down, and molded into the tale millions of people know by heart today. But what if that first fevered, dreamlike writing about this moment of profound historical upheaval were to be resurrected itself, brought back to life in a haunting fable for our modern age? THE HARROWING OF HELL is a revolutionary vision of a dying man‚Äôs descent into the darkness to save humanity from all manner of jailers.

In a richly symbolic, densely illustrated allegorical tale that echoes back to us from ancient times, EVAN DAHM reinterprets one of the most important religious figures in history, before the was the god of the wealthy and powerful, before he was recast as the warrior worshipers preferred.

options.name: It's Your Funeral
options.desc:
Marnie Winters was going to turn her life around; get out of the house, make friends, no more ‚ÄúMiserable Old Marnie!‚Äù Everything was going to plan, but then, of course, she died. Now, Marnie‚Äôs a ghost trapped on Earth, and the only one who can help her is the overenthusiastic, alien social worker, Xel, whose job is to help ghosts ‚Äúclose their file‚Äù and pass on. Are you ready for a sweetly nostalgic trip through Marnie‚Äôs life, correcting mistakes and righting what once went wrong? Well sorry, this isn‚Äôt that story! Xel has a much better idea to soothe Marnie‚Äôs troubled spirit: an internship in the hopeless bureaucracy of the trans-dimensional Department of Spectral Affairs!

This new do-gooder duo has their work cut out for them in a series of hilarious mishaps and misadventures throughout the space-time continuum (but mostly in and around the office) as Marnie finds pathways through her feelings of worthlessness by helping others.

options.name: The Last Delivery
options.desc:
A phantasmagoric dark fantasy unlike anything you‚Äôve ever explored before, from the wild imagination behind RICE BOY & THE HARROWING OF HELL.

An anonymous parcel delivery boy arrives at a sprawling and chaotic mansion, in search of a Resident who must sign for the package he bears. But this task grows into a horrible odyssey.

The vast mansion hosts an endless, frenzied party, and its revelers impede his every step. As his quest takes him deeper into the dripping, black bowels of the labyrinthine house, his mission grows into his single purpose for existence, and his determination to find the Resident may prove to be his undoing.

options.name: Mage and the Endless Unknown
options.desc:
Peek through the leaves, beyond the clouded mountains, and you will find a garden with a strange attendant and an even stranger purpose. A young mage, asleep in a meadow, wakes to delights and fanciful spells that open a door to unknown wonder. Then, they eagerly step through to find only horror and death. There is no swashbuckling adventure in store; this world means them cold and deadly harm, and they‚Äôll need all their resilience, wit, and magic to push it back.

Gaze through fascinating silent windows into a terrifying dimension and follow the wordless Mage and their companions as they travel a shadowy fantastical land of monsters. Will they survive this endlessly curious mystery, or will the unforgiving darkness swallow them whole?

options.name: New Worlds PDF
options.desc:
Combining twenty-four different science fiction and fantasy stories by twenty-four different creative teams, this anthology comic focuses on culture clash, exploring what happens when difference civilizations, worlds, and species meet. These are stories of discovery, conflict, communication, misunderstanding, and exploitation. It revels in the wonder of the new, but reminds us that one person's adventure can be a whole community's tragedy.

Contributors to new world include award-winning creators like Carla Speed McNeil, comics veterans such as Matt Howarth, internet superstars like Zach Weinersmith, and fresh voices like Blue Delliquanti.

options.name: Rice Boy PDF
options.desc: Rice Boy is a surreal fantasy graphic novel set in a world called Overside. A lonely creature called Rice Boy and an ageless machine called The One Electronic venture through a strange world to fulfill a prophecy with implications few understand.

options.name: Radium Girls
options.desc:
It‚Äôs 1918 in Orange, New Jersey, and everyone knows the ‚ÄúGhost Girls.‚Äù

The proud holders of well-paying jobs at the local watch factory, these working-class young women gain their nickname from the fine dusting of glowing, radioactive powder that clings to their clothes after every shift painting watch dials. The soft, greenish glow even stains their lips and tongues, which they use to point the fine brushes used in their work. It‚Äôs perfectly harmless . . . or so claims the watch manufacturer.

When teeth start falling out, followed by jawbones, the dial painters become the unprepared vanguard on the frontlines of the burgeoning workers‚Äô rights movement. Desperate for compensation and acknowledgement from the company that has doomed them, the Ghost Girls must fight, not just for their own lives but the future of every woman to follow them.

A stunning graphic novel retelling of the shocking and inspiring true story.

options.name: Stars, Hide Your Fire
options.desc:
Think of the future.

You excited?

You scared?

You excited and scared?

Andrea and Darra have just started high school in their dead-end Massachusetts hometown with no clear idea of life after graduation. But a chance encounter with a spirit named Carmen promises to make sure their future is bright. However, a strange boy named Liam warns the magic comes at a price. Now the future they want is in reach, but are they willing to sacrifice their friendship?

options.name: The Sea in You
options.desc:
15-year-old Corinth was just trying to clean up the beach; she never expected to meet a mermaid, let alone be nearly drowned by one. It was the start of a very strange friendship!

After Skylla, the deadly fanged mermaid, mysteriously lets Corinth live, they grow closer through a cautious exchange of stories, gifts, jokes, and sign language. Mermaids, it turns out, eat people, but however terrifying Skylla may look, she‚Äôs a little younger, a little smaller, and perhaps a little too soft for all that. Bewitched by Corinth and their growing bond, she learns about all the best things in life on land: books, burgers, donuts, and this strange chattering human sound called laughter. But a storm is brewing‚Äîboth at sea and in Corinth‚Äôs increasingly dangerous relationship with her obsessively jealous boyfriend‚Äîand a magical bargain may be the only thing that can save her, at a tremendous cost.

options.name: Student Ambassador: The Silver City
options.desc:
The ex-president has an international incident that only a younger version of him can solve! he needs... a student ambassador!

When former president Tex Olman, impressed by Joseph and his creative problem-solving, asks for his help on a trip to Mexico, it‚Äôs a dream come true. Not only does he have the adventure itch, Joseph has always wanted to learn more about his ancestral roots in the vibrant, ancient city of Zacatecas. But this vacation isn‚Äôt all churros and museums (though it does have those!). There‚Äôs a legend that ghosts haunt the city‚Äôs famous silver mines, and it‚Äôs starting to seem like more than just a story! Joseph will need his deep knowledge, knack for friendship, and adventurous mettle to decode secret messages, explore dangerous caves, and save the city... that is, if the Ghosts of Zacatecas don‚Äôt get him first! Student Ambassador is a globe-trotting action-adventure set in the real world where dangers mount, the stakes are high, and smarts save the day!

options.name: Student Ambassador: The Missing Dragon
options.desc:
When eight-year-old student ambassador Joseph Bazan wins a photo op with the President of the United States, he doesn‚Äôt quite know what to expect, but it certainly isn‚Äôt hanging out with the leader of the free world in a secret compartment inside the resolute desk! Joseph‚Äôs pluck and kid logic not only charm the president, but they soon help resolve a thorny trade dispute. This gives POTUS an idea. Across the ocean, eight-year-old boy king Nang Nukatau III has taken his father's crown and clumsily stumbled into an international incident, and now Joseph‚Äôs got a pressing mission: talk the tiny dictator back from the brink of war!

The diplomatic slumber party soon goes from awkward to scary as the castle is stormed and the boys are lost across South Korea and Japan where they have to outrun bad guys, learn to read Hangul, unravel the riddle of Gyeongbok Palace, break out of an abandoned bathhouse, befriend an army of snow monkeys, and crack the Case of the Missing Dragon!

options.name: The Poorcraft Cookbook
options.desc:
The Poorcraft series is the essential comic book guide to practical urban and suburban frugality! Whether you're new to independent living, a recent college graduate, or just downshifting to a simpler lifestyle, Poorcraft comics can help you with everything from finding a home to finding a hobby, dinner to debt relief, education to entertainment.

We've shown you how to live better, travel better, and now . . . learn how to eat better on the cheap with The Poorcraft Cookbook. This comprehensive guide features tips and tricks for vegetarian and vegan meals, cocktails, budget food shopping, kitchen equipment ideas, and loads of delightfully illustrated recipes from around the world.

options.name: Indiginerds
options.desc:
First Nations culture is living, vibrant, and evolving‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶and generations of Indigenous kids have grown up with pop culture creeping inexorably into our lives. From gaming to social media, pirate radio to garage bands, Star Trek to D&D, and missed connections at the pow wow, Indigenous culture is so much more than how it‚Äôs usually portrayed. These comics are here  to celebrate those stories!

Featuring an all-Indigenous creative team, INDIGINERDS is an exhilarating anthology collecting 11 stories about Indigenous people balancing traditional ways of knowing with modern pop culture.

options.name: Patience & Esther
options.desc:
Patience is a kindhearted country girl, eking out a living in Edwardian England as tremors of social change rock the world around her. When she starts her employment in formal service on the grounds of an opulent country manor, she has no idea that her own personal revolution is about to begin.

Selfless, dutiful, and just a touch naive, she takes to both her place as a parlor maid and to her new roommate, the bookish and progressive lady‚Äôs maid, Esther. In another time, the two women would have kept one another‚Äôs company forever in their little attic bedroom, living out their days in the employ of a Lord. But it‚Äôs now the dawn of a new age. The expanding empire has brought with it not only plundered wealth, but worldliness and new ideas. Suffragists agitate in the street, idle-rich bohemians challenge sexual mores, and Patience and Esther slowly come to realize the world is wider and full of more adventure and opportunity than they ever imagined.

options.name: YOU DIED
options.desc:
DEATH awaits us all.

Really, it's the one thing we all have in common. But that doesn't make it easy to talk about. None of us can agree on what happens after the end comes, how much we should think about it beforehand, or even what death should mean to the living. And these questions make a lot of folks uncomfortable. So, let's get into it!

This anthology features an introduction by death positivity movement pioneer and activist mortician Caitlin Doughty, and a murderers' row of comics talent‚Äîincluding Raina Telgemeier, Shae Beagle, and Lisa Sterle‚Äîrelating their favorite stories, myths, hopes, and suspicions about death, dying, and even The Great Beyond.

options.name: The Last Halloween
options.desc:
For every human on Earth, there is a monster connected to them.

Now, the barrier keeping them out of the human world is has been broken, and they‚Äôre all loose, wreaking havoc across the planet.

Chased out into the Halloween night, 10-year-old Mona meets some very strange new friends: a ghoul, a vampire, and her own monster. Together, they search for the only human who can restore the barrier, save the world, and keep this from being the Last Halloween.

options.name: Penultimate Quest
options.desc:
Far across the Western Ocean on a mist-shrouded island guarded by giant sea monsters, heroes come to explore the mysterious dungeons that lie below the surface. None have yet to reach the bottom and return to tell the tale. Each party gathers daily for a new round of potion-making, sword-sharpening, armor-buying, and dungeon-crawling, and after hours of leveling up in dangerous battles with monstrous creatures from the depths, they rest and try again the next day when everything repeats. That is, until one adventurer stops to ask why. Is it endlessly exciting, or simply endless?

In a witty, genre-defying tale of magic, mystery, and philosophy, brave warriors must learn the difference between diversion and escape as they try to break the cycle of a penultimate quest in which the final fantasy never arrives.

options.name: As the Crow Flies
options.desc:
Camp Three Peaks is a rustic, Christian summer retreat for teenage girls. It offers them a week of hiking, adventure, and communing with the God of its 19th-century founders . . . a God that doesn't traditionally number people like 13-year-old Charlie Lamonte among His (Her? Their? Its?) flock.

The only black camper in the group‚Äîand queer besides‚Äîshe struggles to reconcile the innocent intent of the trip with the blinkered obliviousness of those determined to keep the Three Peaks tradition going. As the journey wears on and the rhetoric wears thin, Charlie can't help but poke holes in the pious disregard this storied sanctuary has for outsiders like herself‚Äîand her fellow camper, Sydney.

As the Crow Flies is a Stonewall Honor Book, and is the first volume in a series!

options.name: New Worlds
options.desc:
Combining twenty-four different science fiction and fantasy stories by twenty-four different creative teams, this anthology comic focuses on culture clash, exploring what happens when difference civilizations, worlds, and species meet. These are stories of discovery, conflict, communication, misunderstanding, and exploitation. It revels in the wonder of the new, but reminds us that one person's adventure can be a whole community's tragedy.

Contributors to new world include award-winning creators like Carla Speed McNeil, comics veterans such as Matt Howarth, internet superstars like Zach Weinersmith, and fresh voices like Blue Delliquanti.

options.name: Rice Boy
options.desc: Rice Boy is a surreal fantasy graphic novel set in a world called Overside. A lonely creature called Rice Boy and an ageless machine called The One Electronic venture through a strange world to fulfill a prophecy with implications few understand.

Could be an extra treat for yourself or whomever you have in mind when you support us? Thank you for being here regardless, William!

replies.text: Thanks Benton!! We're so excited to bring this to print and to have you backing us! ^^ Be sure to share the link with anyone you think might have someone this is just the thing for, you never know who it'll reach!

project.name: ODE TO SEX: An Exquisite Collection of European Erotica
project.description: From the renowned publisher of ground-breaking science fiction, esoteric fantasy, and gritty crime comes something‚Ä¶more carnal.

creator.name: Humanoids
creator.biography: Humanoids embodies creative innovation, a fiercely independent spirit, and a drive to break new ground.

titre: SPECIAL TECHNIQUE - A Feast for the Eyes
texte: For half a century, Humanoids and their anthology Metal Hurlant have reshaped the landscape of our collective unconscious. Though they are best recognized for breaking down barriers (of the creative and spiritual kind), they have also been known to erect.

After decades of ushering sequential science fiction, adventure, and fantasy masterworks into the English-speaking world and beyond, reinvigorating mind and spirit, they thought it high time to honor the FLESH.

A carefully curated collection of exquisite erotica from the greatest European masters, including works never before published in English, each presented in the classic European format: Sleek. Oversized. Hard.

ODE TO THE X: a 60-page color book. A magnificent, sensual anthology, that unites eighteenth century experts of licentious verse with top tier artists and twentieth century foxes such as M≈ìbius, Liberatore (RanXerox), Loustal, and Bess. Within these pages, the dreamy drawings of Beb-deum illustrate the erotic words of Belleau, the bawdyness of Pierre Motin meets the frank and straightforward line of Chauzy, and M≈ìbius packs the rhymes and assonances of Patin de la Fizeli√®re into a psychedelic comic strip worthy of his greatest works. Eight original couplings come together in a pleasure feast for your senses.ANGEL CLAWS: a 72-page B&W book. The quintessential Humanoids duo of Alejandro Jodorowsky and M≈ìbius leads us on a sensual and poetic journey through a young woman‚Äôs sexual awakening and agency. What begins as suggestive eroticism quickly evolves (or devolves) into metaphysical delirium. This cult favorite is presented here for the first time in our oversized European format, enriched with an afterword by the one and only Diana Widmaier-Picasso.

TEARS OF SEX: a 160-page B&W and duotone book. Master of eroticism Alex Varenne‚Äôs rare and daring ‚Äô80s works presented in a magnificent omnibus edition. This work, a series of vignettes, is a singular amalgamation of literary poetics, high art, and comics dedicated to the sensuality of women whose fantasies Varenne not only reveals, but arouses to fruition, and to the passion of various couples who find themselves in liminal spaces illuminated by mutual desire.

These LUXE EDITIONS are crafted to the highest production standards. Each volume is printed on luxurious 140 gsm art paper, hardbound with traditional sewn binding and a rounded spine, and finished with head and tail bands, along with as a satin ribbon marker. Presented in our signature oversized European format (9.4 √ó 12.6 inches, 24 √ó 32 cm), these editions showcase covers designed specifically for this release and unavailable in any other format.

For collectors who appreciate discretion as much as distinction, we also offer our SAFE-FOR-IN-LAWS EDITIONS. These include the full LUXE EDITION enhanced with an elegant translucent vellum jacket. Designed to tastefully soften the explicit imagery while allowing a subtle glimpse beneath, it strikes a deliberate balance between refinement and provocation.

Both the LUXE and SAFE-FOR-IN-LAWS editions are strictly limited Kickstarter exclusives. They will not be distributed through standard retail channels. Any future availability, if offered at all and only on the Humanoids online store, would be limited to remaining copies from the original print run and presented at a higher price point.
Images shown are prototypes or digital mockups. Final printed products may vary slightly in color, materials, and finish due to the manufacturing process.

Paris in 1975 stood in the long aftershock of May 1968, as the certainties of the old bourgeois order were fracturing under the weight of economic slowdown, rising unemployment, and a profound generational and cultural upheaval. In this climate of tension and transformation, where institutions were questioned and hierarchies challenged, Metal Hurlant and Humanoids were born. Rather than retreating into the shadows, their founding fathers chose to seize their chosen medium to push against boundaries and conventions, giving voice to their fears, their dissent, and their wildest dreams and fantasies.

Metal Hurlant, since its origins, has been very open about sex and the representation of sexuality, including its oft-deviant nature, but always with a unique elegance that honored and explored, as opposed to mere exploitation. There are countless treasures published throughout Humanoids‚Äô early years, one of the most profound being the sophisticated yet vulgar allegory of Polonius, penned by Picaret and illustrated by the renowned Jacques Tardi. Originally published in 1976, the rare, complete, 44-page tale is republished in English (for the first time since 1977) in Metal Hurlant Issue 4: Paradise Lost, available through this campaign. Read more about the careful technique used at the time to create gray tones, both in this work by Tardi and in Varenne‚Äôs, A Feast for the Eyes.
Though he may not be an English-speaking household name, when it comes to erotic bandes dessin√©es, Alex Varenne is widely and critically recognized as the master of his generation.

In 1979, he and his brother Daniel created the dystopian science-fiction series Ardeur (available in French from Humanoids and never published in English), through which he refined his erotic sensibility with a handful of truly iconic love scenes in the monthly magazine Charlie Mensuel (yes, related to Charlie Hebdo).

In this major work and those that followed, Alex Varenne came into his own with his iconic chiaroscuro style, rendering men and women alike not only in a sensual and attractive light, but with a quintessential ‚Äô80s awareness of fashion and beauty, elevating his rather explicit material into realms of higher, more sophisticated graphic art.
To this day, Varenne‚Äôs work can be identified (and titillate) from a mile away. Alex Varenne passed away in Paris in 2020, at 81.
‚ÄúFeminine and masculine collide here in a romantic discourse.‚Äù ‚ÄîDiana Widmaier-Picasso‚Äôs in her Afterword to Angel Claws

While explicit and occasionally challenging, all works showcased in this collection were created with integrity, passion, and a willingness to explore the deepest corners of our subconscious through the safe, surreal space of the page. While many of the contributors here are men, we believe that each creator has, in their own right, channeled their divine masculine and feminine sides to access these narratives of sensual- and sexuality. We look forward to our next collections highlighting some of our incredible women artists and spotlighting their respective fantasies.
A word from the publisher about Varenne and Tardi‚Äôs gray-tone technique

When Tardi drew the pages of Polonius fifty years ago, computers were not part of the process. If an artist wanted black-and-white pages with nuanced gray atmospheres, options were limited. You could paint the page in gray wash, but printing results were uncertain. Or, to keep dense black lines, you could draw the page, then paint the gray areas on a reduced reproduction of the original, printed in blue on paint-friendly paper, which would be scanned and combined with the film from the original black line. It worked, but it was complicated and costly.

The alternative, if you were meticulous, patient, and talented, was self-adhesive screentone: in Europe, Letraset; in the United States, Zip-A-Tone. Charles M. Schulz used it for the gray spots in his Peanuts strips, though in a light and simple way.

Screentone was a transparent adhesive sheet printed with a halftone pattern. You cut it to shape and applied it directly to the original art, where it stayed in place, or you laid it over the area to be shaded and trimmed away the excess with an artist‚Äôs knife. These pages are surprisingly hard to reproduce today, and modern printing does not automatically make it easier.

Several key works in this campaign, Varenne‚Äôs Tears of Sex and Tardi and Picaret‚Äôs Polonius (as published in Metal Hurlant Issue 4), were made with this method, which gives them the distinctive gray tones we love, a look largely lost since the arrival of digital tools.

Only a few cartoonists truly mastered it. Varenne pushed the technique to its limit. He drew on acetate with a pen and brush, using ink that bites into the plastic, then applied screentone to the reverse of the transparent sheet to build those atmospheric grays. The first time I met him, in early 1989 to discuss Tears of Sex (the year I took over Humanoids), Alex told me that inking on plastic made the line extra fluid and helped the spontaneity he was after while inking. You can catch a glimpse of his breathtaking originals in the opening scene of this campaign‚Äôs video (yes, they are originals...).

To my knowledge, among all the artists Humanoids has worked with over the past fifty years, Varenne is the only one who used this unique technique and did wonders with it. Even beyond Humanoids, I do not see another comparable example.
‚ÄîFabrice Giger

As a rare and exquisite offering to solidify the link between ODE TO SEX and METAL HURLANT, we are offering a high-quality print of the UNCENSORED cover of Issue 4: Paradise Lost drawn‚Ä¶and SIGNED‚Ä¶by Nicollet himself (the same artist behind Heavy Metal Magazine‚Äôs #1 cover), making this print a highly limited Collector‚Äôs Item.

This print will only be available to backers of this campaign who a) back at the ODE √Ä LA MODE tier (Standard or Early Bird); or b) add on a 2-Year Metal Hurlant Subscription (Hardcover or Softcover, first time). Please note that current Metal Hurlant subscribers who renew their subscription for a two-year period will also receive the Magnum Reward; they do not need to take any action at this stage and will receive a subscription renewal e-mail in due time.

We realize that for this campaign, we are attracting connoisseurs of the medium. So in order to tailor our campaign so that you can tailor your own personal preferences, we are offering each of our editions (Digital, Luxe, and Safe-For-In-Laws) √† la carte in the Add-Ons section.
There, you will also have access to the following Metal Hurlant offers:

IMPORTANT NOTE: The pledge prices listed DO NOT INCLUDE SHIPPING OR VAT, which will be calculated and applied once you fill out the final pledge manager survey after the campaign (more on that below). This helps us ensure sufficient postage is collected without overcharging you with unspecific estimates upfront.
Final shipping rates will be calculated based on actual weights and current postage rates at the time of campaign closure.

After this Kickstarter Campaign officially closes (and not before), we will send out a follow up survey to the email address associated with your Kickstarter account. This will allow us to open a direct Pledge Manager account with you to keep track of your rewards and delivery on this campaign.

We will be sure to post a Kickstarter Update letting you know when the survey stage has been initiated, but please also look out for an email from The Humanoids Store (store@humanoids.com) that will contain instructions about verifying your account.

WARNING: If your Kickstarter account is associated with an Apple ID (or if your actual email is masked by a Private Relay Apple ID), our communication attempts will be blocked on your end. Since we will NOT be able to directly communicate with you about the survey or Kickstarter updates, YOU must write US directly to have your account information changed in our Pledge Manager.
We cannot fulfill your order without a completed survey and paid shipping. If you do not receive your survey, please contact us directly at store@humanoids.com.

comments.text: Hi Humanoids, my favorite publisher! Is there any chance of including Jodo‚Äôs double secret short story with Sylvain? And not for this campaign but, what about translating Jodo‚Äôs Gilles Hamesh and La verite est au fond des reves? Thanks! Love you guys!

replies.text: Greg's Favorite? What an honor! Thank you for your support and enthusiasm. We couldn't do this without readers like you. This campaign is pretty set, but who knows what the future holds... Thank you for sharing your fantasies with us, Greg...

comments.text: So, I went ahead and got the $200 bundle. Every time I tried to select just a digital volume, it did not load "add-ons"; but, when I selected a physical volume--like the $200 bundle--"add-on" options appeared.

replies.text: Hi Eric, to clarify, if you back at a digital level, only the digital add-ons appear, but when you back at physical, the physical and digital add-ons appear. That said, we are happy to hear you decided to go with XXX Early Bird as it's unquestionably the best deal and reward. Don't worry about your address for the time being. You will be able to update/confirm this at the survey stage when we send out our pledge manager. Thank you so much for your support and enthusiasm!

comments.text: How do I add another book onto my order? I would like to get two digital volumes, one of ToS and the other OttX. Do we add those as "add-ons" later in the campaign? Thanks

replies.text: You have to do it now if you want to use the early bird pricing. Go to the MANAGE YOUR PLEDGE button and first make sure that you're happy with your main pledge. If you proceed after that one of the next steps is adding add-ons. Choose your pick by adding them. Then finish your pledge and you're good to go.
Thanks for jumping in, Jurriaan! Eric, were you able to figure it out? We just refreshed some digital add-ons, so if not, try again now.

comments.text: Maybe a silly question, but how much of the content of TEARS OF SEX is stories?

replies.text: @Brent Staggs thank you. Do you have a name of that story or any further informations/sources?

Hi Dave (and Brent), not a silly question at all. This first English edition of Tears of Sex contains the original material from Les Larmes du sexe, published in French in 1989, which marked Varenne‚Äôs first collaboration with Humanoids, along with all the additional stories he later created in the same spirit for us in the following years.
@Humanoids thank you as well. You confirmed what Brent said and I already put it on my menu. üòÅ

comments.text: Wish there was a Non-SFIL bundle, and without the print.

replies.text: Seriously. Why are they forcing us to purchase the print? I just want the bundle same as you.

Hi Ramon and James. No one is forcing anyone to do anything...this is all about consensual exchanges. But please keep in mind we have to incentivize our readers in various ways. You can't always get what you want! But sometimes...you can. Take a look at our recent update ;)

comments.text: I would like to pledge all three volumes with the early bird pricing, but I do not wish to purchase the print. Is this possible? Thanks.

replies.text: Hi again, James. See our other comment on your other comment for a sweet little surprise.
I've updated my pledge. Thank you for doing that!

comments.text: Cette personne a annul√© son engagement.

replies.text: Hey Mark, thanks so much for your continued support on Metal. We couldn't do it without you guys. And of course you don't need to support this campaign to extend, we are just creating throughlines between the projects due to their shared roots. You needn't take any action right now! After issue 4 is sent out, you'll receive a renewal notification from us. At that time, you can select how long you want to extend for (and if you select 2 years, you'll also receive the Nicollet signed print!).
Cette personne a annul√© son engagement.

comments.text: Another great kickstarter!

replies.text: Hey Timbo! Thanks for the kind words. Never say never, as we are indeed thinking about a potential Metal Hurlant special issue, but not right away about sex. That said, our upcoming Issue 4 is about Lost Paradise, and without revealing too much, sex is not a stranger to it.

comments.text: Just to be clear, are the SFIL vellums removable to reveal the full cover art underneath?

replies.text: Hello Tariq! Yes, the SFIL vellum jackets are removable, and the art on the book cover is then fully exposed.

comments.text: I understand that y‚Äôall don‚Äôt do Stretch Goals, but I would‚Äôve loved to see a reprint Moebius‚Äôs Eros X Libris as part of this campaign.

replies.text: HI Gopakumar! It‚Äôs true, stretch goals can be very tricky and our campaigns are already fairly elaborate. That said, it IS a great idea.  Let‚Äôs see what the future holds! Thank you for helping to brighten it.

comments.text: Would it be possible to add the early bird rewards as add-ons while they're available? I'm trying to order both "Ode to the X" and "Angel Claws" and take advantage of the early bird discount, but can't the way they're listed right now

replies.text: Hi Mangymangy. Thank you for your support and interest in our project... Take a look at our most recent update. We think you might be pleasantly surprised.
Thank you! I appreciate the effort you put into the books, super excited to get them :)

comments.text: Can we get a slipcase for the books? I really love the way you guys package them!

replies.text: Hello, our dearest Aviramelior! Unfortunately, we will not be offering a slipcase for this campaign. That said, we appreciate you expressing your interest! And fear not, there will be more slipcases in Humanoids (and your?) future.

comments.text: That was fast! üôÉüü¢ü´†

replies.text: That's what she said.
I really was asking for it.
...we're biting our tongue.

comments.text: so i have backed the Angel claws book , would have been nice if we could have had this as a numbered book with signiture of Diana Widmaier-Picasso.

replies.text: We agree, that would have been very nice! We appreciate your support anyway!

comments.text: The signed print should be an add-on!

replies.text: Sorry, Victor! We have to incentivize sooooome things, and access to Nicollet is sacred. BUT, we have made everything else purchasable √† la carte. We appreciate your understanding!
I don‚Äôt need three copies of the book, certainly not with censored covers. I already backed metal hurlant for two years, will i get the print for that?

comments.text: Does the 'pledge without a reward' allow add-ons, or will people be required to purchase a pledge with rewards, to access the add-ons?

replies.text: Hi BHan! We just tried and we don't think this is possible (from a platform standpoint). But that's okay because there are no add-ons offered that are not also offered here in the campaign as a tier (not to mention, you can benefit from some of the early bird pricing for these first 48hours), which would then give you access to additional add-ons! If you are specifically interested in the Metal Hurlant subscriptions, these can be obtained via our next campaign or through our Humanoids Store.
Thanks, Humanoids. I appreciate the quick response.

comments.text: It's Humanoids, Moebius, Jodorowsky. It might not be scifi but it's well worth backing.

replies.text: We couldn't agree more, Jurriaan. Thanks for consummating our campaign with your presence.

comments.text: No pay over time option? Especially when all 3 books are $170? That kinda sucks.

replies.text: Brent, yes, Crespin‚Äôs ARMALITE 16 will happen at some point, as it is a book we truly love. And to answer Tommy‚Äôs point, Ibrahim Moustafa‚Äôs HALFBLOOD is also very much in our plans.
Can you share when Armalite 16 might be coming so I can prepare? That's the book I want the,most out of all these kickstarters.

Hi Brent, ARMALITE 16 is definitely coming. It is likely to happen this year, but we still have a few other campaigns planned before it. ARMALITE 16 is a major book, and we are currently working through the best way to publish it so it gets the first English edition it deserves. We are also considering including the other shorter stories Crespin created for Humanoids and Metal Hurlant back in the day. Thanks again for your interest in Crespin‚Äôs work.

project.name: Fathom Timeline Omnibus: Volume 1
project.description: Michael Turner's Fathom is now presented in this new innovative Timeline Edition Omnibus! Read Fathom as you never have before!!

creator.name: Aspen Comics
creator.biography: ASPEN COMICS is an independent publishing company founded in January 2003, priding itself on creating entertainment properties of the highest quality visual and storytelling elements. Aspen produces the best-selling property Michael Turner‚Äôs Fathom, the popular fantasy series Michael Turner‚Äôs Soulfire, as well as such fan favorite series as Lola XOXO, Executive Assistant: Iris, Jirni and many more. Aspen has collaborated with Marvel Comics for various hit projects, including cover work for the best-selling events Civil War, World War Hulk, and Ultimatum, and worked closely with DC Comics to provide covers and comic work for such best-selling titles as Superman/Batman: Supergirl, The Justice League of America, Dark Knight: The Last Crusade, Rebirth and Eisner-nominated covers for the critically acclaimed, best-selling series, Identity Crisis. In 2018, Aspen joined forces with Marvel Studios Founding Chairman David Maisel, in collaboration with his founding of Mythos Studios, who are currently developing Ekos, for feature film and other multimedia projects.

texte: ASPEN COMICS‚ÄîWe're home to some of the comic book industry‚Äôs most popular independent titles such as Ekos, Fathom, Soulfire, Shrugged, Charismagic, BubbleGun, Fathom: Kiani, Lola XOXO, and many more awesome properties!

Aspen has launched five successful Kickstarter campaigns, from last year‚Äôs smash hit Ekos Volume 2, to our debut Kickstarter offering, Michael Turner Creations, and our follow-up hit series Fathom: The Core and Soulfire: The Core! Plus, with Ekos Volume 1 and last summer's The Marvel Art of Michael Turner, which we co-published with Clover Press--fans have come to expect that our Kickstarter campaigns and products will be of the highest quality and featuring the industry's top superstar talents!
Connect with us:
ASPEN FACEBOOK ACCOUNT
ASPEN INSTAGRAM
ASPEN X ACCOUNT

comments.text: Are there any non-metal bookmarks planned? I could use some new bookmarks but I‚Äôm not sure I want metal ones. I feel like that could damage the pages in books.

replies.text: Hi Matthew,

comments.text: Hi there, I was wondering if these bonus goals that we unlock are provided for all tiers?

replies.text: Hi Griffin,

comments.text: Hi.  Just curious‚Ä¶. Issue 11-13 of original volume 1 to Fathom will  that be reprinted here in the new version that was in previous collections?

replies.text: Hi Matthew,

comments.text: Hi dear Aspen Comics Team !

replies.text: Hello, Sevy_Flo,

comments.text: Hello, I'm curious, I've seen in another post the table of contents. Are Fathom: Beginnings and Fathom: Prelude included? Since both happen before the Vol. 1 story but I've not seen them in the contents.

replies.text: Fully understand! That's one of the top questions we always get asked at conventions is what is the best order to read Fathom or where do I begin? That's why this book will now exist! Thanks so much for the support!

One last question (because again I don't see it on the campaign), is Fathom: Preview also included? And will it be in colored form? I believe this was first issued in black & white? It's a memory stretch, I only ever read that once more than 20 years ago and can't really recall it. Thanks again.
Yes! The Fathom Preview will be included in this book fully colored. Thanks!

comments.text: Will we be able to add additional available add-ons when the survey is sent out?

replies.text: Hi Phillip,

comments.text: Please don't limit the rewards to just the higher tiers, at least add one of the metal bookmarks to tier 1.

replies.text: Agreed üëç
Hi MK,

comments.text: Hi if I adjust my pledge after 72hrs do I still get the bonuses? I was also wondering if there were any stretch goals? Or is that what the bonuses items are? Thanks!

replies.text: Hi Griffin,
Great thanks!

comments.text: Can I assume that the 1$ pledge will grant access to the post campaign pledge manager for add-ons?

replies.text: Hi Gregor,

comments.text: Hi, really looking forward to adding this book to my MT Fathom collection, will go nicely next to the statue. Now about more MT Aspen A3 prints.. :-)

replies.text: Thanks for the message, Kam! Yes, this book will look great next to the Aspen statue! We'll keep more prints in mind for the future. Thank you!

comments.text: For completion sake, Volume 2 should include the Swimsuit Editions, and slipcases would be nice add-ons.

replies.text: Hi Sean,

comments.text: How does this compare to the Michael Turner Creations book a few years ago. Same content or different? Thank you.

replies.text: Hi Jim,

comments.text: Any chance on getting any of the artists to sign the hardcover? Even if it is an add on cost, thay would be a nice touch.

replies.text: Hi Nick,

comments.text: Will there be a way for tier one people to get the kiana metal bookmarks?

replies.text: Hi Sarah,

comments.text: Is there a pay over time option? I don‚Äôt think I can pay for the version I want without it. üòû

replies.text: Hi Griffin,

comments.text: Very much looking forward to having this in my hot little hands but I have a very very very important question????  Is it possible to buy the necklace pouch separately????

replies.text: Hi Carolyn,

comments.text: Hoping this does well so we can  have aspen comics books in local comic stores and book stores again like the old days

replies.text: Hi Brandon,
Good to hearI can't wait, I've been reading your comics since  2006, in fact your comics got me into comic books when I was a teenager with your aspen free comic day #1 ‚ù§
Aw, that's great to hear! Thanks so much for sharing and being a part of our Aspen family for so long!

comments.text: Glad to see this! I lost my Micheal Turner‚Äôs Creations Hardcover in a flood about two years ago. I‚Äôm excited to have at least the Fathom portion back in oversized hardcover format! üôÇ

replies.text: Hi Matthew,

comments.text: Another instant backed project by Aspen. Excited to add more Fathom to my collection & some stunning art from Alex. Excited to see you all at SDCC again!

replies.text: Woohoo! Thank you, Timothy! See you then!

comments.text: I can't find the add on for the mystery Comic packs.

replies.text: Hi David,

comments.text: Pity there‚Äôs no-add on for all the metal trading cards.

replies.text: Hi Rob,

comments.text: Can you include what issue #s are included in this release?

replies.text: I'm curious what happened with issues 10-12
Great question, Duo!
Ohh I see. Thank you for clarifying!! You guys rock!!

comments.text: Was surprised to see this being offered but so glad it is. It will sit well on the shelf next to all my other Aspen and Michael Turner editions.

project.name: Singularity: Horror Novel Grafic- Interactive
project.description: "Suspense and horror graphic novel with a cyberpunk style, interactive and entertaining, that unveils its mysteries.

creator.name: Angel SEVEN
creator.biography: Buenas soy ingeniero y escritor amateur, en un futuro tengo pensado muchos proyectos; novelas, videojuegos, cortos o Inteligencia artificial

texte:
All funds raised through sponsorships, donations, and patrons will be used entirely to support the development and ongoing improvement of this interactive cyberpunk suspense and horror graphic novel / experience.
Specifically, the money will go toward:
Paying our programmers, who are building the interactivity, branched narrative paths, sanity system, dynamic glitches, choice mechanics, and exclusive post-credits content.
Compensating our writers, who are responsible for crafting the deep storylines, disturbing dialogue, revelations about Dc. Micron Skyrunner, the mysteries of the Funhouse, and the dark cyberpunk tone that makes this work unique.
There are no middlemen or unnecessary expenses: every dollar contributed goes directly to the people creating and expanding this universe for you.
Thanks to your support, we can continue to pay for their talent, time, and dedication to deliver more chapters, alternate endings, hidden files, and updates that make Micron‚Äôs amusement park increasingly twisted and immersive.
Your contribution doesn‚Äôt just fund a project ‚Äî it keeps the glitch alive and allows the creators to keep dreaming (and terrifying) alongside us!

Singularity
A scientific horror interactive graphic novel
A sealed mansion.
A forgotten laboratory.
Hundreds of inactive androids‚Ä¶ staring at nothing.
And one name erased from every record:
Dr. Micron Skyrunner.
Singularity is an interactive graphic novel that blends scientific horror, psychological mystery, and puzzle-driven exploration. Every object is a clue. Every room is a question. Every discovery changes what you think is real.
You awaken with fragmented memories inside the abandoned Skyrunner Complex ‚Äî a research facility shut down after an experiment that should never have existed.
No bodies.
No staff.
Only humanoid machines standing in silent rows‚Ä¶ and systems that still power on as if they were waiting for you.
Something here recognizes you.
üß† Gameplay
Inspired by classic point-and-click adventures and narrative horror experiences:
Side-scroll exploration through detailed pixel-art environments
Interactive inventory (inspect, rotate, combine objects)
Logic-based puzzles grounded in physics and real science
Sanity system: what you see may not be trustworthy
Branching narrative choices and multiple endings
Environmental storytelling through notes, photos, recordings, and fragmented memories
Nothing is decorative.
A rusted ring. A family photograph. An android‚Äôs outstretched hand.
Everything tells a story.
üî¨ Science + Horror
The facility is built around real scientific concepts:
Gravitational singularities
Consciousness transfer
Quantum entanglement
Neural replication
Artificial intelligence ethics
Temporal paradoxes
These aren‚Äôt background themes.
Solving science is how you survive.
üìñ Story
Dr. Micron Skyrunner was a prodigy.
A physicist obsessed with defeating death itself.
His research promised to ‚Äúpreserve humanity.‚Äù
Then funding vanished.
Staff resigned.
The project was buried.
And then‚Ä¶ silence.
Now you explore his mansion-laboratory, reconstructing his final days through broken memories, incomplete androids, and experiments that still feel alive.
Soon, a deeper question emerges:
Was Skyrunner trying to save humanity‚Ä¶ or replace it?
And something worse:
Are you truly an investigator‚Ä¶ or the Doctor‚Äôs last experiment?

Why did I choose this linear format instead of episodes?
I want the story to feel like an immersive movie or graphic novel: intense, emotional, and with an uninterrupted rhythm. Every decision matters because it's part of an organic whole, and the impact of your choices builds gradually toward the climax and ending (with multiple possible conclusions depending on your paths).

And a demo?
If the campaign is successful and we reach (or exceed) the funding goal, my plan is to release a free playable demo 2 month before the official launch of the full game. This demo will include the introduction + the first major story arc (about 20-25% of the full experience), so more people can try it, experience the atmosphere, and share it.
This way, all backers get exclusive early access to the complete version first, while the demo helps build wider interest and community in the lead-up to release.

How We Plan to Create It (Main Steps from Now to Final Delivery)
Currently, the full direction of the story is already complete: we have the entire script, narrative structure with all arcs, branches, revelations, well-developed characters, and detailed emotional handling. This allows us to move forward in a very focused and efficient way.
The main steps are as follows:
Final Writing and Refinement (ongoing / nearly complete): Polish dialogues, ensure consistency across branches and the sanity system, and prepare all text for integration.
Art and Visual Assets (in progress): Create or finalize pixel art environments, character sprites, backgrounds, and interactive elements, using tools like Adobe Firefly for quick prototypes followed by manual refinement. (IA)
Programming and Interactivity (next major step): Our programming team will implement the core mechanics: choice-based system (clicking buttons to select options/dialogues), branched paths, simple inventory, sanity system (with dynamic visual glitches and effects), and logic-based puzzles rooted in real science. The game is primarily choice-based (button selections for narrative decisions), combined with light point-and-click elements (clicking objects to inspect, rotate, or combine them), making it accessible and heavily focused on horror storytelling.

Integration and Internal Testing (after programming): Combine all elements (art + narrative + code), test branches, choice outcomes, sanity balance, bugs, and performance across different Windows PCs.
Beta Testing with Backers (optional, if time/margin allows): Share an early version with a small group of backers for feedback and final polishing.

Compile the complete version as a Windows executable (.exe), package it, and deliver to all backers.
The entire process is designed to be linear and efficient, thanks to the existing narrative foundation.
How We Will Distribute It
Main Format: Digital download DRM-free as a Windows executable (.exe). This is a standard, secure, and straightforward option for indie narrative games like this: backers simply download the file, run it, and play offline without any additional client or constant internet connection required.
Primary Distribution Platform: We will use itch.io (the most popular and reliable platform for DRM-free indie games). We‚Äôll set up a private or restricted project page exclusively for backers, where they can download the .exe directly (or via the itch.io app, which handles automatic updates). itch.io is perfect because:
It supports importing your Kickstarter backer list directly (via CSV export from Kickstarter), granting automatic access to matching emails.
Allows private/restricted pages, exclusive download keys, or backer-only URLs for secure delivery.
Handles updates seamlessly: upload a new version (patches, bug fixes, extra content), and backers get notified and can download automatically.
It's free to publish, widely used by the indie community (especially for horror/narrative titles), and ensures true DRM-free ownership.
Alternatives if Needed: For extra security, we can provide private links via Google Drive or Dropbox for specific backers, but itch.io will be the main hub for simplicity and reliability. In the future, if the project expands significantly, we may consider adding Steam support, but the priority is DRM-free and easy access right from launch.
Updates and New Content: Any patches, bug fixes, additional chapters (if expanded post-launch), or extra content will be uploaded directly to the same itch.io page. Backers will receive automatic notifications (via email or the itch.io app) and can download updates at no extra cost. We‚Äôll also use Kickstarter updates to announce and explain changes.
This ensures all backers receive the full game first, in a clear, hassle-free way. If the project grows, we‚Äôll evaluate ports for Mac/Linux, but the initial focus is Windows for fastest delivery.
