project.name: Survival Chronicles
project.description: From podcast to page: survival, guilt and hope in a fallen world.

creator.name: Sam
creator.biography:
I am the creator of Survival Chronicles, a project born from a narrative process that began as a podcast, where the universe and characters of this story first started to take shape.

The graphic novel is a natural evolution of that narrative ‚Äî a more intimate and visual way to explore themes such as memory, guilt, and survival in extreme circumstances.

The project combines writing and black-and-white graphic storytelling, with a direct and handcrafted approach.

This campaign makes it possible to take the next step: transforming that story into a complete and tangible work.

texte: SURVIVAL CHRONICLES
A graphic novel about guilt, memory, and the weight of staying alive.

This is not a story about heroes.
It is the story of someone who simply survived.

Survival Chronicles began as a podcast, where this narrative universe first started to take shape. What began as an audio story now evolves into a black-and-white graphic novel, bringing the world into a more intimate and visual dimension.

In a devastated world, with no clear rules and no easy redemption, a man writes.
Not to be remembered.
Not to justify himself.

He writes to avoid disappearing.
To avoid becoming one of those nameless bodies that dissolve into dust.

The book is drawn in traditional ink, with a raw and direct style. Each page blends introspective narration with scenes from a collapsed world, where violence is not epic, but heavy. Uncomfortable. Human.
The story does not glorify survival ‚Äî it questions it.

What does it mean to stay alive when nothing remains?
What weighs more: fear‚Ä¶ or guilt?
THE TEAM

Script and Concept: Sam
Illustration: Gemma Vegas
The script emerges from handwritten diaries and personal reflections that gave birth to the podcast. The graphic novel expands that universe and transforms it into a visual narrative.
Gemma Vegas translates that inner voice into the language of drawing: black and white, traditional ink, strong contrasts that reinforce the emotional weight of each scene.
WHAT IS THIS PROJECT?

‚Äì A printed physical graphic novel
‚Äì Black and white, traditional ink style
‚Äì First edition, signed and numbered
‚Äì Approximately 60 pages
Each copy will be carefully produced as a physical object meant to be preserved.
A digital edition will also be available for those who prefer that format.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
This campaign will fund:

‚Äì Completion of the full illustration process
‚Äì Editorial production and final layout
‚Äì Printing of the first edition
Crowdfunding allows this work to exist independently, without relying on traditional publishing houses ‚Äî allowing it to be brought to life directly by the community that believes in it.
CURRENT STATUS

The project is currently in active development.
The first pages are already illustrated.
The full script is in its final stages.
The campaign will finance the completion and production of the book.

project.name: Gas and Tin: Layer 1
project.description: A soldier descends into the dark depths to save humanity, but finds himself in a world of chaos.

creator.name: Philip Riley
creator.biography: An independent Filmmaker who loves all forms of animation. Loves to write and draw.

texte: Gas and Tin is a horror/fantasy graphic novel. A young soldier is sent to the deep depths of the world to find precious materials needed for humanity's survival. Accompanied only by a small robot, they both acquire these materials together. However, when the time comes to return home, something is amiss. No one is coming. With no choice, they must go up to the surface. Passing the layers of the depths.

A giant hole filled with layers, each layer different from the rest. Changes in climates, creatures, and some don't even make sense. They are forever changing, so you don't know what you're going to get when entering one. However, humans have harnessed this power to a degree. An elevator leading to one of the layers was constructed, making only two stops. But what happens if the elevator doesn't come down, what happens if you are left alone?

A skilled young soldier tasked with finding materials to save humanity. He has a wife waiting for him at home. Seeing her again and keeping her safe is what drives him to keep going. He fears almost nothing and was hand-picked for this mission among thousands of candidates. (concept art)
A small robot was sent with the soldier to help him on his expedition. He is equipped with maps, weapons, and information on the depths. (concept art)

Vicious Creatures that crave the hunt. They will hunt and kill anything that moves. They come in all different shapes and sizes. There are many different types of creatures in the depths; the example image above is only a fraction of what roams the land. (concept art)

Like most stories I have written/drawn out, I am inspired by films and Video Games. For this project specifically, I was inspired by works of art such as "Birdboy: The Forgotten Children" (Alberto V√°zquez, Pedro Rivero), "Mad God" (Phil Tippett), "Pan's Labryinth" (Guillermo del Toro), "The Midnight Walk" (Klaus Lyngeled, Olov Redmalm), and "Reanimal" (Tarsier Studios). If you like this project, stay tuned for this story; it might just be your thing, and if you haven't checked these out yet, do yourself a favor.
Tier 1- Digital Copy
Tier 2- Sticker Pack
Tier 3- Physical Copy (signed)
Tier 4- Hand-drawn sketch (signed)

project.name: Jewish Weirdo's Guide to Grief: a graphic novel
project.description: Laugh, cry, and feel affirmed in your grief journey

creator.name: Chana Gelbard
creator.biography: Jewish queer about town biking around Washington DC. Into radical inclusivity, kindness, & when my kitty sleeps with her paws curled up over her face

titre: Why I wrote Jewish Weirdo's Guide to Grief:
What do I hope this book will do for my readers?
texte: The day my mom Deborah died in 2024, someone gave me a popular book on Jewish grief. Like most resources on Jewish grief, it was normatively masculine and heteronormative. The tome included a large section on whether women‚Äôs voices were too holy to participate (yikes).
But I desperately needed a similar resource that would instruct me about Jewish grief and what was expected of me. My friends and loved ones needed one too.
Thus Jewish Weirdo‚Äôs Guide to Grief was born.

In writing my book, I took inspiration from a long line of Jewish graphic novelists and cartoonists ‚Äì Stan Lee and Art Spiegelman for two notable examples. Graphic novels have a long Jewish history of helping us parse hard topics through funny or subversive pictures.
Who is this book for?
You might ask, who is a Jewish weirdo? I claim this term for everyone like me who draws from the margins toward the middle, who enjoys or is curious about inclusive Judaism.

My friends and loved ones, who wanted to be supportive during the aninut (period of time between death and burial), shiva, and beyond, needed a resource like this. They wanted to support me but didn't know what was expected of them or what to say.
Jewish or not, if you want to help someone grieve Jewishly, you‚Äôre enough of a Jewish weirdo for me.

We all feel lost and alone in times of great grief. In times such as these, Judaism has ancient scripts for us to follow. I want to show my readers how those ancient scripts, updated for my modern lens, helped me and can help them.

For one example, shiva practice instructs us to stay close to each other for the first seven days of grief. ‚ÄúShow up and give them silence,‚Äù an ancient Jewish precept about shiva, is one of my personal favorites.
In the midst of grief, there may simply be nothing you can say. You can sit next to the griever and look into the crater where their life used to be.

But over and over, Jewish practice has helped me feel surrounded by care in the midst of devastating grief. I hope that my book will be a light-hearted introduction to the ways Judaism helps us move toward each other in grief.

transportation costs to get the books to bookstores: about $300
costs to ship to my California readers -- about $870
costs to ship to my overseas reader -- about $50
fees for processing/Kickstarter fees -- about $860
TOTAL costs: $9460
finish book 2025 ‚úÖ
editor finishes editing 2025 ‚úÖ
book goes to printer end of Feb 2026
500 copies received early April 2026; books go to storage
250 books to local bookstores mid-April 2026
up to another 250 books packaged and delivered late April 2026

I will ship exclusively to readers in the continental USA for this first limited-edition printing. The first 250 books will be first come, first served for shipping. The remainder go to my local DC and Baltimore comic books stores.
I will ship only to the continental USA for now. I will make one exception for my mom's best friend who lives in Asia. In the future, I would love to get my book worldwide.
Shipping costs: shipping is approximately $7 for any readers in the continental USA. But for my $100+ backers, shipping is included.
My assistant and I will handle packaging the books and shipping them from the nearby USPS. I will drive the remainder to my local comic books stores.
Happily, most of my readers are local so they can get their copies from the local comics stores.

project.name: We'reWolves: 1st Collector's Item Issue | 2nd Sun
project.description: Supernaturals with powers. A world mirroring, Rated M war for survival. Love, Hate, Betrayal, and Science...Unapologetic and Off-Script

creator.name: Randy Valentine Madison
creator.biography:
After 50 years of life navigating ADHD and finding the traditional doors of employment slammed shut, I stopped looking for a seat at someone else's table and decided to build my own. Black Heart, an imprint of Every Day is Valentine's Day Publishing, was born out of necessity and a refusal to be silenced.

I started writing because I had to. All other doors were closed, so I had to kick one open. I began with children‚Äôs books, but I moved into comics because the world needed a 'Wolf' that the gatekeepers were too soft to provide. While the sheep were following weak leaders and pulling wool over everyone's eyes with soft stories and fragile heroes, I was sharpening my teeth.

We are Wolves. We are hungry. I‚Äôm in the kitchen, let me cook. It‚Äôs time to eat. It‚Äôs time for Absolute Change.

titre: We'reWolves: 1st Collector's Item Issue | 2nd Sun | The Change is Absolute
"The door has been kicked off the hinges."
texte: The face of the Change. This isn't just a book; it's a manifesto. Issue #1: The Change is Absolute.
The "Super" has been stripped from the Hero. The "Super" has been stripped from the story.

The gatekeepers got comfortable, and the sheep took over. They‚Äôve been pulling the wool over your eyes with stories that are baaaaaaaad. When you count all the sheep writing these "meh" stories and character swapping, it just makes you so sleepy because it all adds up to one thing: Superhero Fatigue.
The sheep aren't hungry anymore. They‚Äôre just following the herd. Even the movie industry starved us of stories that were already written.
Well, all that is about to change. We are hungry.
And since you are what you eat... we aren‚Äôt going to eat them...we‚Äôre going to chew them up and spit them out.
Who are we? We‚ÄôreWolves.
This isn't an advertisement; it's a warning. The era of the "soft" hero is dead, and the beast is finally out of the cage.

Join the WolfPack. Back the Change. To all the wolves in sheep's clothing who tried to play along just to end up asking, "Howl can they do that?"...we heard your call. We don't like what they changed comic books into.
We are going to Make Comics Great, Again!
If you‚Äôre fed up with the same old shepherds and hate the direction the industry is heading, I have the answer: Change is Coming! Sooner than you think. 2026.
Who are we? We'reWolves and we're "Super."
Join the WolfPack, now!
Sometimes Silence Can Be So Loud.
The first four pages will leave you speechless...especially since they have no dialogue. They don‚Äôt need words, hype, or talk bubbles; the panels speak for themselves.
Look closer. Can you find the hidden message in the first two pages of color before the world turns black and white?

This is a world of humans and supernaturals...some born with power, some man-made, and some... other. Their world is closer to ours than you think; some people are just better at hiding than others. But remember: we all have a little monster in us, especially in the dark.
The Line-up:
Club Patron 1: Oh Yes! I needed a change in scenery!
Club Patron 2: The founder of the online retail KeyPoint owns this club.
Club Patron 3: I can't wait to get inside! This is going to be good!
Club Patron 4: It's so cloudy tonight, I hope they let us in before the rain starts!
L.J. (Latanya Jefa): I'm told they only let the right people in now. I just hope they don't have a scale at the door, LOL!
The Holdup:
Club Patron 1: What‚Äôs the hold up? I need a drink, and I gotta pee.
Club Patron 2: She really thought she was getting in looking like a boy? With her chest that flat, the bouncer‚Äôs probably checking her ID just to see if she is one.
Club Patron 3: Hush, y‚Äôall too loud, I am not with y'all.
The Bouncer: I‚Äôm sorry, pretty eyes, your name doesn‚Äôt seem to be on the list.
L.J. (to herself): {That‚Äôs the only thing they all find attractive about me...my eyes.}

L.J. (out loud): These pretty eyes can see just fine...even with you making the font size smaller. See? There‚Äôs my name right there, under your thumb: L.J. When you give me the thumbs up to go in, you‚Äôll see it.

The "Super" doesn't just return in the action...it returns in the attitude. Step into the VIP lounge of Club Key, where the air is thick with neon and secrets. This is the moment the change becomes personal.
Meet India and Amabo (A Mama's Boy) as they cross paths for the first time.

"People don't meet by accident. Everyone who crosses our path is either a test, a lesson, or a blessing." In the world of We‚ÄôreWolves, this meeting is all three. Amabo is the apex predator in every room; his charm is hypnotic, and his presence is overwhelming. But in this world, things move at a "Phantom Phase" pace...and if you don't slow down to see what's really lurking in the shadows, you‚Äôre bound to crash and feel trashed!
Amabo (to himself): {Damn, she smells good.}
Amabo: Hello gorgeous, my name is Amabo, and you are?
India: Hi, I'm India.
Amabo: Hello India, I might have to borrow you from your man.
India: Borrow? I don‚Äôt have a man for you to return me to. I‚Äôm single by choice.
India (to herself): {Although the choice wasn‚Äôt mine!}
Amabo: Well you're in good hands with me. Do you mind if I sit? Did you come here alone?
India: It depends. Where is your woman? I don‚Äôt want to be caught up in any nonsense.

Even on a Sunday night, the energy inside Club Key is electric. But beneath the "beautiful music" and the flashing lights, the real world is never far away. While the dance floor whispers about werewolves and "racist" supernatural fears, a shadow moves through the back of the room.
What's the deal with the guy in the black leather jacket? He isn't dancing, and he isn't drinking.
[At the DJ Booth]
Bottle Girl 1: Can‚Äôt believe this DJ is going so hard on a Sunday night!
Bottle Girl 2: It doesn‚Äôt matter what day it is, DJ Hook always be jammin‚Äô like it‚Äôs the weekend.
Bottle Girl 3: We can make beautiful music together!
[On the Dance Floor]
Party Goer 1: This DJ is an absolute beast! I want to see if he changes into a werewolf tonight!
Party Goer 2: Oh God, don‚Äôt mention supernaturals, they totally freak me out!
Party Goer 3: Don‚Äôt say that, that‚Äôs racist!
[The VIP Table]
Amabo: Well I can be toxic but good guys are boring from what I hear.
India: And I don't like to be bored. Well tell me, 'A Who?' what's your name again?
Amabo: Amabo, it means, ‚ÄòA mama's boy‚Äô. They say, you should watch how a man treats his mother. And you‚Äôll know how he‚Äôll treat you.
India: Is that so? So I assume you treat your mother pretty good I presume.
Amabo: I did. I gave her the care she deserved. But sadly she passed.
India: Sorry to hear that.
[In the Shadows]

Mystery Man (to himself): {Hmm. Notification says that security guard, 'Tyler Coughlin,' is here tonight. As soon as Ralph finds me some concrete evidence that he‚Äôs touching kids, he‚Äôs going to need security...because I‚Äôm going to have Tyler coughing up blood.}

The music is loud, but the conversation at the VIP table just got quiet. While India tries to play it safe by asking about his "status," she has no idea that the "Mama's Boy" is already making his move. The storm is coming, and it‚Äôs not just raining outside.
Is India as "normal" as she claims? Or is Amabo sensing a secret that she hasn't even admitted to herself?
Amabo: It‚Äôs OK, she lived a fruitful life.
India: Hope the apple didn‚Äôt fall far from the tree.
Amabo: Ha! ‚ÄòFall from the tree!‚Äô Anyway, what about you, gorgeous, what are you drinking?
India: I‚Äôve been drinking Martinis but I was just wrapping it up, I have work in the morning.
Amabo: But the night is young and it began raining. Why don‚Äôt you stay till the storm passes?
(India and Amabo lock eyes. India is unaware that Amabo‚Äôs hand is glowing purple near her drink, causing it to splash.)
India: So Amabo... forgive me for sounding rude, but you gotta ask these days. You never know. What were you born...Human? Supernatural? Other?
Amabo: I hate that question. The answer is quite dark... but trust me, ain't nothing 'wrong' with me. In fact, I'm greater than all those put together. What about you? I'm sensing something in you...
India: (Laughs) Who, me? Funny, I‚Äôm normal. Just had to get that off my chest. I don't like surprises.
Amabo: Well, what you see is what you get with me. Just a mama's boy.
[The Waitress Station]
Waitress 1: Look alive, girls. Don't want no one thinking you're a vampire. How many people in here do you think are vampires?
Waitress 2: Lord, I hope none. Keep them far away from me!
Waitress 3: That‚Äôs not nice...I have a vampire in my family.
Waitress 4: We all have at least one.
[A Table in the Crowd]
Club Patron (Man): What did the werewolf ask the hot sheep waitress? 'Howl do you taste?'
Club Patrons (3 Women): (Laughing)
Club Patron (Man): Funny, right? His wife was with him but she didn't get the joke.

Digital Shadows In a world obsessed with status and followers, some people prefer to stay off the grid. But just because you don't have social media doesn't mean you aren't being followed. While the charm offensive continues in the VIP, the "Storm" Amabo mentioned is getting closer than he realizes.
India: Do you always dress so well? Give me your social media handle and I‚Äôll give you mine. I want to see what you're posting.
Amabo: I‚Äôm not on social media. I never had much luck with followers... they usually just end up blocking me.
[In the Shadows]
Mystery Man in Black Leather Jacket (seen only from behind): "Hmmm!"

While the sheep dance under the strobe lights, the real work happens in the silence of 4 Rest St. This isn't a club, and it isn't a game. Deep inside The Apex, the future is being grown in liquid tubes...and the straight jacket isn't just for show.
Some secrets are too dangerous to leave the lab.
[Page 11: Full Page Splash]

(The scene shifts to a cold, high-tech facility. RALPH is seen from the back, a silhouette against a glowing blue light. He is standing before a massive, reinforced liquid tube. Inside the bubbling fluid, a Straight Jacket floats, suspended as if waiting for a wearer.)
[Page 12: The Crucible]
(The interior of The Apex, located at 4 Rest St. A place of clinical precision and hidden horrors.)
Ralph (to himself): {Patience. Every predator needs a cage until they‚Äôre ready to be the storm.}
[The Crucible - Inside The Apex]

Ralph: Kiana, where's the rest of the WolfPack? There's a storm rolling in, the moon is full tonight, and where‚Äôs Julius? He was the last one I showed the ‚ÄòMosqui-Tags‚Äô to... and I know precisely how many are supposed to be in that tray. Now, the count is short.

Kiana: Slong is in his garage working on a weapon for Chrono. And you know I haven't seen ‚ÄòVapor.‚Äô Like ‚ÄòMimic,‚Äô he could be anywhere. Who knows? ‚ÄòPup‚Äô stayed home; he was feeling down after he went to court for child support. I'm going to call him before the change tonight, just to check on him.

Kiana (cont.): The rest of the Pack took the ‚ÄòFlyingWolf‚Äô to Transylvania on that ‚ÄòOperation PReD‚Äô mission. And Julius? I don‚Äôt know. One minute he was playing on his phone, the next he‚Äôs grabbing his leather jacket. I asked him where he thought he was going and he just said, 'Out!'
Ralph: Out? I should have used a ‚ÄòMosqui-Tag‚Äô on him. Kiana, did Levi finish mixing the serum we need for the Straight Jackets?
Kiana: We‚Äôre working as fast as we can sir, We‚Äôre only human!
Ralph: We must move faster before I‚Äôm not.

Ralph: Levi, if my calculations are correct, this serum for the ‚ÄòStraight Jackets‚Äô will act as a power-stripping sedative. It should neutralize a vampire's abilities long enough for us to transport them to the Institution.
Levi: Understood, sir. And about Julius... I offered to go with him, but he‚Äôs off-leash, Ralph. You know he thinks he works better solo.
Ralph: But what kind of 'work' is he doing? I‚Äôm expecting Chrono to be here any minute now, after he‚Äôs done his studying.

Ralph (to himself): {The Moon Rock particles...or 'Mr.' as y'all call it. In their raw state, they‚Äôre a god-tier stimulant for wolves and vamps alike. But here in the Crucible, I‚Äôve learned to invert them. Now, they're the only thing keeping that jacket from being torn to shreds.}
[SFX: WARP SOUND]
[The Apex - Main Level]
[SFX: WARP SOUND]

Chrono: Hello? Anyone home? (Jokingly, to himself) Hope I ain't too late... should 
I...howl?
Levi: Welcome to Apex 4 Rest, Chrono. I‚Äôm Levi. He‚Äôs expecting you; he‚Äôs in the Crucible.
Chrono: (To himself) Okay, the Crucible... am I supposed to know where that is? I have warping powers, but I don‚Äôt know where everything is at.
Levi: It‚Äôs 14 floors below us.
Chrono: Wait, what? How did he know what I was thinking? Does Levi have mind-reading powers? That‚Äôs warping cool!
Levi: And no, I don‚Äôt have mind-reading powers. I know because that‚Äôs what everyone asks. I am human...neither werewolf nor vampire.
Chrono: Well, gee, thanks Mr. Levi. Just 14 below?
Levi: Yes, Chrono. But wait...just 'Levi.' No 'Mr.' Save that old title for the Moon Rocks.
Chrono: Okay, ‚ÄòMr.‚Äô is warped out of my vocabulary. Nice to meet you!
[SFX: WARP SOUND]
[The Crucible - 14 Floors Below]
Wolves have the nose. Vampires have the sight. But in a city full of shadows, sometimes biology isn't enough. Ralph isn't just relying on nature anymore...he's perfecting it.
Welcome to the future of the hunt.
[The Crucible]
(A warp portal rips open in the center of the lab. CHRONO steps through, stumbling slightly as he spots a digital monitor. On the screen, a Mosqui-Tag is transmitting a high-def feed of its target.)
Chrono: Hey Ralph, the warpster is here. Oh cool, what is that?
Ralph: I just talked you up, kid. And look at these...this is the latest from the Crucible. I call them Mosqui-Tags.
Chrono: They look like... robot flies?
Ralph: Not flies, kid. Mosquitoes. Bats love mosquitoes. It's a natural snack for a predator that thinks it‚Äôs the only one hunting tonight.

Chrono: (Scratching his head) Okay, but why the tech, Ralph? I mean, at the fire, I‚Äôve seen Julius and the pack find people who were still in the burning building even after the firefighters cleared it. You guys have keen scent-tracking in human form, and once you shift into the wolf? You could sniff out a needle in a haystack. Why use these when we already have the noses for it?

In the old days, you followed the scent. But in a world of Phantom Pace and high-speed escapes, the old ways are too slow. Ralph‚Äôs newest invention doesn't just track a target...it becomes a part of them.
Once you "accept the terms of service," there is nowhere left to run.
[The Crucible]

Ralph: (Pausing, looking at a Mosqui-Tag in his hand) Because fire doesn't run, Chrono. But these Unionist leeches are slippery. Between their Phantom Pace and their ability to hit the sky as bats, they can drop a scent trail or cross a river before you can get a second whiff.
Chrono: So, the nose isn't enough for them?

Ralph: The nose tells you where they were, Chrono. These Mosqui-Tags tell me where they are. They are highly sophisticated, noncombustible tracking devices designed to sample blood on contact. If the DNA matches a particular suspect, assuming I have a baseline...the tag is ingested.
Chrono: Ingested? Like... they eat the bug?

Ralph: Precisely. Once it's inside them, it‚Äôs a beacon. I can track that target for up to 100 miles, with a precision radius of five feet. They can run, they can fly... but with this, they can't hide.
Chrono: So I can follow someone on my smartphone, like on social media?
Ralph: (Thinking to himself, face hardening) {Which is exactly why Julius took them...}
Ralph: Precise... Location. But only after they've accepted the terms of service...

Forget everything you think you know about heroes and villains. In the Crucible, being "smart" and "civilized" is a death sentence. Ralph is issuing a challenge not just to Chrono, but to the entire genre: Stop being pathetic. Start being brutal. When the Red comes, the conversation ends.
[The Crucible]
Chrono: Wow, that‚Äôs warping awesome!
Ralph: And you‚Äôre The Warp Master. Kid, take no offense to what I‚Äôm about to say. I know you got a lot of green going on, but this ain't about you. Take yourself out of the equation.

Ralph (cont.): Everything ain‚Äôt what it seems. We live in an opposite world now. Right now? I‚Äôm Green. I‚Äôm fresh, I‚Äôm 'smart,' I‚Äôm a regular 'Professor'... and I am weak. I wouldn‚Äôt hurt a fly, Chrono. I‚Äôm as soft as they come. No fight in me. In this world, Green means Stop. It means I‚Äôm a dead man walking.
Ralph: But when that Red comes? Red means GO. Red is brutal. Red is a mindless, prehistoric beast. Red is strength you haven‚Äôt seen in forever. I‚Äôm talking about real strength.

Ralph: So forget the nursery rhymes they taught you. When you see Red, you move! Green is pathetic right now, but if you step up tonight? You might just make Green great again. You never know who‚Äôs watching. Don‚Äôt tell me you‚Äôre ready. Show me.
Chrono: (Nervously) I won‚Äôt let you down, sir! ...Hey, is Slong here?
Kiana: He's down the hall in the Scardy-Cat Garage. I mentioned your... 'situation' to him. He‚Äôs the best one to talk to about it.
Chrono: Gee thx, Key Key, I‚Äôve been working on new send-off phrases. How do you like this one: 'Warp, Warp, and Awaaaay!'
[SFX: WARP SOUND]
Kiana: (Shaking her head) Weak! That would give me superhero fatigue!
[The Scardy-Cat Garage Door]

(Chrono warps to the door and knocks.) 

Chrono: Whoa, hold on! Before we introduce y'all to 'Slong the Mechanic,' Ralph says: 'Since this is just a Kickstarter Collector's Preview, it's not smart to give away the whole first issue for free.' So, I was told to warp y'all out of the garage, skip over the White House scene, and get you back to Club Key where the party continues... until you have the book in your hands. Tighten your grip... we‚Äôre warping back to Club Key!
Warp successful. We're back in the heart of the city under heavy rain.
Already in progress... behind closed doors.
India thinking to herself: I can‚Äôt get him out of my mind and Amabo reminds me so much of him.
Amabo: Are you OK gorgeous? I had to come in here, to see if everything is alright? A lot of bad people are in this club. They say, the Freaks come out at night!
India: Sorry to keep you waiting, I needed a min. Drinks got me feeling a little ... woosie!
India: It‚Äôs getting late, I think I should go!
Amabo: Please, don‚Äôt leave yet gorgeous. The night is young, and the party has just begun!
Amabo: Why are you looking at me like that?
India: You remind me of someone I once knew!
Amabo: He must have been incredibly handsome!
India: Indeed he was, now come here! And give mama a kiss!
India thinking to herself: Damn he smells good.
India: Whew! You‚Äôre strong! Don‚Äôt drop me!
Amabo: I got you. I will never drop you, gorgeous.
Amabo: Someone's coming! I'm going to take you somewhere more private.
India: Oh, fancy. All this for me? You shouldn't have.
Amabo: Nothing's too good for my... um...
India: In-dia. It's India.
Amabo: I know your name. I was just testing you.
Club Patron 1: Here‚Äôs the ladies room right here
Club Patron 1: I would tell them to get a room but this is a room technically. So maybe I should say, 'can you make some ... room?'
Club Patron 2: LOL Girl, be quiet, they can hear you!
[Kissing sound coming from the stall]
Club Patron 1: Y‚Äôall see that hot DJ checking me out?
Club Patron 2: Girl he wasn‚Äôt checking you out, he was eyeing me!
Club Patron 3: He wasn‚Äôt checking for either one of ‚Äòy‚Äôall, I caught him watching me.
[At the same time all 3 say]
Club Patron 1: I got his number!
Club Patron 2: I got his number!
Club Patron 3: I got his number!
[SFX: Visual Chaos - Slurp! Slurp! Lick!
Twirl!]
Club Patron 1: I‚Äômma see if she needs any help?
Club Patron 2: Girl be quiet, if you don‚Äôt leave them people alone!
[SFX: Visual Chaos - Smash! Bang! Boom! OMG! Bam! Pow!]
Club Patron 1: I can‚Äôt keep a man, we‚Äôll be helping each other!
Club Patron 2: Girl hush, C‚Äômon with your crazy self!

We're only pulling wool over the eyes of the sheep to get them close, but we ain't crying wolf... wolves don't cry. We're hungry and our stories have bite. Grandma is dead and We'reWolves. This ain't a children's book. Join the Pack.
The gatekeepers tried to lock the industry down with their watered-down stories. We‚Äôre here to break the lock. And this is just a taste of the beginning.
Back the Pack. Who is the man in the leather jacket? Where did Amabo vanish to so quick? And is India in a danger she can't imagine? The 'Super' has returned.

Pack, I was going to kick off this Kickstarter much harder than this, but I don't want to show my full wolf power and come off too alpha, scaring the sheep. I just wanted to get my foot in the door. Change is Coming. We'reWolves.

project.name: LRP's Wheelchair Girl
project.description: A real-life inspirational story about a 12 year old dancing champion - in a wheelchair - from a small village in Kazakhstan.

creator.name: Lets Roll Productions
creator.biography:
Mohammad (Moh), a disability rights advocate, inventor, filmmaker, and motivational speaker, founded Rim Power (www.rimpower.org) in 2016 to promote accessibility and redefine normal for wheelchair users. Surviving the trauma of war in Afghanistan, losing his mother, and becoming paralyzed at age five, Moh‚Äôs resilience brought him to the U.S., where he began rebuilding his life.

By 2015, Moh showcased his 3D-printed wheelchair inventions to President Obama at the White House Science Fair. A year later, he graduated from Cambridge Rindge and Latin School and continued patenting adaptive tools and creating graphic novel heroes with physical challenges. Through Rim Power and beyond, Moh inspires wheelchair users globally to embrace empowerment and full societal participation.

texte: Promoting ‚ÄúWheelchair Girl‚Äù Let‚Äôs Roll Production‚Äôs Newest Graphic Novel Publication.
The Journey of Empowerment

Mohammad Sayed (Moh), a disability rights advocate, inventor, and motivational speaker, disabled himself as a youngster in Afghanistan, started his mission to ‚Äúredefine normal‚Äù by promoting and advocating accessibility and inclusion for wheelchair users and the disabled at large. Now through Lets Roll Productions, Moh continues this mission with powerful stories told with dynamic graphic novels and short films that inspire and empower disabled people to be heroes in their own right - everyday. If you have followed our stories up to now, you already know that LRP‚Äôs first disabled superhero, Wheelchair Man came to life in 2016 and told the story of a fragmented childhood and the rocky path to becoming a superhero. Moh is faced with the ultimate consequences of war at a very young age. His childhood is abruptly halted by the all too common violence against civilians. By confronting his physical obstacles and tremendous loss, Moh is able to gain an extraordinary ability. This power allows Moh to aid and prevent harm to those who experience similar losses due to the brutality of war. Wheelchair Man‚Äôs story resonated with over 4,000 readers across Afghanistan, Ecuador, Kazakhstan, and the United States. The story was translated into Dari and Pashto, printed, and distributed throughout these countries. Notably, the state department sponsored these trips.
Introducing ‚ÄúWheelchair Girl: Let‚Äôs Rebuild Afghanistan‚Äù

‚ÄúWheelchair Girl‚Äù is the captivating story of a 12-year-old wheelchair user, once a dance champion, from Kazakhstan. Mentored by Wheelchair Man because of her extraordinary abilities, she embarks on a remarkable mission to rebuild Afghanistan after years of devastating wars to its former glory - despite the many challenges in her path. This graphic novel not only tells her inspiring story but also highlights the strength, resilience, and potential of individuals with disabilities to overcome seemingly impossible odds to achieve their dreams and help others to do the same.
Why This Graphic Novel Matters?
Building on the success of ‚ÄúWheelchair Man,‚Äù which inspired disability awareness initiatives in Afghanistan, ‚ÄúWheelchair Girl‚Äù aims to:
o Promote Disability Awareness: Showcase the capabilities and achievements of wheelchair users, or any disabled individual who never lets their disability stand in their way.

o Empower Young Readers: Inspire children with and without disabilities through relatable, heroic characters that they can aspire to, fostering a sense of confidence, resilience, and the belief that they too can achieve greatness.
o Foster Inclusion: Support global conversations about accessibility and diversity.
Support Our Mission:
We are launching a Kickstarter campaign to fund the publication and distribution of ‚ÄúWheelchair Girl."
o Printing Costs: $3,000 for 600 units
o Shipping Costs: $1,200 for 600 units
o Merchandise: $5,800 for t-shirts, hats, and stickers to promote the novel.
This is the first phase of our campaign. In phase two, we aim to produce two short films to scale our message.
Join Us

Your support will help us share ‚ÄúWheelchair Girl‚Äù with the world, inspire countless individuals, and continue our mission to create an accessible, inclusive society. Together, we can redefine normal and rebuild hope.
Wheelchair Man: Hope Is On The Way - Afghanistan
Wheelchair Man Ecuador Trip:

project.name: The Combine Driver | 2-in-1 Ratchet & Torque Screwdriver
project.description: A Repairable Precision Screwdriver Kit | 60-Tooth Ratchet | 1Nm - 8Nm Torque Limiter | 100 Bit Organizer | Modular & Expandable

creator.name: WowFactories
creator.biography:
At Wow Factories, we want to empower people with the right to repair. By that, we mean offering not just tools, but the agency to fix, improve, and keep making.

We are makers who blend engineering precision with emotional resonance, creating tools that are built to last, repair, and grow with you.

By harmonizing logic and emotion, we‚Äôre reimagining what a tool company can be: not just a manufacturer, but a multiplier of better futures by designing tools that are, quite simply, WOW!!!

texte:
We took an honest look at the tools people end up discarding; bent spindles, missing bits, shredded bits, over-moulded parts. 

Failures that come not just from use, but from how they were made.

Tools keep getting fussier and strangely disposable. And that never sat right with us. We believe repair shouldn‚Äôt feel harder than replacement. It should feel intuitive and empowering.

That belief shaped everything that came next -

WE WANTED TO MAKE REPAIR TOOL, REPAIRABLE.
A TOOL FOR VERSATALITY, VERSATILE.
Meet the Combine Driver ‚Äî a modular, repairable 2-in-1 ratchet and torque screwdriver designed for everyday repair and making.
Engineered for precision, built for longevity, and designed as a complete desktop system, it brings torque control, modular bits, and sustainable construction into one thoughtfully designed tool.

A BIT STACK THAT GROWS 
WITH YOUR NEEDS.

Most bit sets are designed as constrained solutions to changing needs. You buy them once and replace them entirely when you need additional bits or wear out the existing ones.

We didn‚Äôt want that.

The Combine Driver Stack was designed as an adaptive system, not a rigid set. A modular kit that starts simple and expands intentionally, without cluttering your workspace or forcing unnecessary replacements.

Whether you‚Äôre beginning with a few essentials or building a serious toolkit over time, the stack adapts with you. Add only what you need. Carry only what you use. Keep everything visible, accessible, and easy to repair.

‚ñéDESIGNED TO BE A DESKTOP SCULPTURE:
The Combine Driver was designed to stay visible, not tucked away.
Balanced proportions, honest materials and an architecture that brings a quiet yet bold presence on your desk.

It‚Äôs a tool you reach for often, and one that feels considered even when it‚Äôs at rest.

‚ñéDESIGNED AS A SYSTEM AND NOT JUST AN OBJECT:
What appears as a single tool is a carefully considered system.‚Ä®A rotary base, modular stack, and the Combine Driver itself; each designed to work independently, yet composed to function better together.

Nothing is decorative. Nothing is fixed.‚Ä®
Every element exists to support access, adaptability, and repair; whether the tool is in use, being reconfigured, or simply at rest on your desk.

‚ñéENTIRE ASSEMBLY HELD TOGETHER BY JUST 6 M3 SCREWS:
The Combine Driver has no adhesives, lock-tights, permanent welds and environmentally toxic surface treatments, making it fully repairable by you.

Sustainability, for us, meant looking beyond the object and designing the system around it.‚Ä®From disassembly to material use and manufacturing methods, each decision was made with the full lifecycle in mind.

‚ñéHERE'S HOW DESIGN AND SYSTEMS THINKING GUIDED OUR APPROACH TO SUSTAINABILITY:

Committing to mono-materiality, we‚Äôve thoughtfully crafted every component from a single material. The Combine Driver is constructed from Stainless Steel 304, S2 Tool Steel, Aluminum and Nylon for their longevity, precision and true recyclability.

The Combine Driver will be manufactured 100% in India, using 96% renewable energy sourced from wind, solar and hydro power.

The product is designed and rigorously tested by WowFactories in Singapore, and will be manufactured in India by our supply chain partner who operates the world‚Äôs largest Metal Injection Moulding facility, supplying precision components to leading global brands such as Apple, Dyson, Samsung, and Foxconn.

Metal Injection Moulding (MIM) is a highly efficient and sustainable manufacturing process that:

‚ñ† Produces near-zero material waste
‚ñ† Uses up to 15√ó less energy compared to traditional CNC machining
‚ñ† Enables high-strength, high-precision metal components at scale

This approach allows the Combine Driver to deliver industry leading build quality and performance while staying aligned with WowFactories‚Äô commitment to repairability, longevity and responsible manufacturing.

‚¨á CAMPAIGN ENDS:
You‚Äôll receive a short survey to select your preferred spindle option.

‚¨á PRODUCTION BEGINS:
We finalize builds based on backer selections and move into manufacturing.

‚¨á SHIPPING CONFIRMATION:
Closer to delivery, we‚Äôll send a second survey to collect your shipping address and request you to choose shipping options from our logistics partners.

Our target shipping date is September 2026.

Please note that the pledge levels do not cover shipping and taxes. Shipping prices vary by location and country. It‚Äôs simpler to handle this separately.

After the Kickstarter is over and we are ready to start shipping, you will receive an invitation to go to our website OR survey link and enter your shipping information to pay the appropriate amount and your shipping address to make sure your product is delivered accurately.

project.name: PortRing - Charge your Phone with any cables | 240W 10Gbps
project.description: Don't throw your old lightning cables away. 240 watt mobile phone charging stand that you can use your old lightning cables to charge.

creator.name: Petdown
creator.biography:
PortRing was born from a simple frustration:
phone stands block charging, and charging accessories don‚Äôt support viewing.
So we rethought the charging port itself ‚Äî turning it into a structural anchor that supports charging, data transfer, and hands-free use at the same time.

titre: Designed for Real Phones, with Real Cases
texte: We intentionally engineered the connector housing with additional clearance to accommodate phones with protective cases. The width aligns with your device, while the depth and structural offset are carefully balanced to ensure the connector remains fully accessible ‚Äî even when a case is installed.

That means no removing your phone case.
No forcing tight connections.
No awkward pressure against the frame.
The interface area is purposefully spaced to avoid collision with case edges, allowing a clean and secure fit across most standard case designs.
Because everyday phones are protected ‚Äî and your accessories should respect that.
PortRing is available in two main connector versions: USB-C and Lightning.

Simply select your preferred quantity when choosing a reward.
After the campaign ends, you‚Äôll be able to choose your connector version in the backer survey. This ensures flexibility while keeping the checkout process simple.
Each unit in a multi-pack reward can be configured individually.

We are a small team of designers and engineers who focus on one thing:
making everyday phone accessories smarter, simpler, and more functional.

We believe great products don‚Äôt add complexity ‚Äî they remove it.
That‚Äôs why we design accessories that integrate directly with your device, using thoughtful structure and engineering instead of bulky add-ons.

PortRing was born from a simple frustration:
phone stands block charging, and charging accessories don‚Äôt support viewing.
So we rethought the charging port itself ‚Äî turning it into a structural anchor that supports charging, data transfer, and hands-free use at the same time.
From early sketches to functional prototypes, every detail of PortRing was designed by our team ‚Äî from the port layout and magnetic balance to real-world case compatibility.

Kickstarter allows us to bring this idea directly to people who value practical, well-designed tools.
With your support, we can turn PortRing from a refined prototype into a product used every day.

project.name: The Dot: A 0-Plastic Weekly Pill Organizer Built to Last
project.description: Seven aluminum compartments, natural wood accents, and a tactile grip - built for everyday use, week after week. Designed to Outlast

creator.name: Thomas
creator.biography: Obsessed with developing new products.

texte: Cheap plastic organizers fail. They break, stick, pop open, and end up replaced - again and again.

So we built something different. A zero-plastic pill organizer designed around a durable sliding mechanism instead of fragile hinges. Machined from aerospace-grade aluminum, it‚Äôs secure, tactile, and made for everyday use.
Buy it for life. This is the last pill organizer you‚Äôll ever need.
I‚Äôve successfully launched multiple Kickstarter campaigns, reaching 2480 backers in total. Every reward was delivered exactly as promised!

We engineered an indexing mechanism that securely locks at each individual compartment. With every precise movement, it delivers a satisfying mechanical click - allowing you to dispense exactly what you need for the day, and nothing more. Built from durable, long-lasting materials, this is precision you can rely on for a lifetime.

A carefully composed package that reflects the quality of what‚Äôs inside. Designed with the same attention to detail, materials, and integrity, so the experience feels considered from the very first moment.

Crafted from aerospace-grade aluminum, this zero-plastic case uses subtle tactile cues to ensure you always open it correctly. A milled grid pattern clearly indicates the sliding direction, while the rear access slot enables effortless one-handed operation. Built for daily use and engineered to endure.
Our mechanism delivers a satisfying click at each compartment, sliding fully open for effortless access. Precise and absolutely durable.

We CNC-mill each compartment with extreme precision to maximize volume while maintaining zero-gap tolerances. The result is a tightly controlled interior that prevents pill migration, keeping even the smallest tablets securely in place.
Every compartment is optimized to fit the maximum number of pills required for a day. Efficient, spacious, and carefully proportioned, so your routine stays simple and reliable.

A solid walnut stand gives your pill organizer a permanent place. Magnetic for secure mounting on metal surfaces, or freestanding as a refined object in your home, designed to keep your routine safe, visible, and intentional.

This product began with a simple idea: create something you would never need to replace. From the earliest sketches onward, durability, ease of use, and longevity guided every choice. Refined through countless prototypes, it‚Äôs designed to support your routine. Quietly, reliably, for life.
Designed to fit naturally into your routine. Compact in size, solid in hand, and precisely balanced to deliver durability without unnecessary bulk.
Weight: 185 g
We‚Äôre building a companion app. A simple, visual extension of the Weekly Pill Organizer.

The organizer itself stays purely physical: no battery, no electronics, no connectivity.
The app works independently, designed to mirror the organizer‚Äôs layout for an intuitive, familiar experience.
See which pills go in each compartment, receive gentle reminders, add notes, and track how you feel over time, all without adding complexity to the product itself.
Planned for release in 2026

A truly thoughtful gift for something that matters every day: health.
Built to be used week after week, year after year, without compromise.
Timeless design, durable materials, lasting value - a gift that shows you truly care.
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 3,500+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $1B raised between them.
This project is featured on HugeBackers, a community of over 169,000+ Backers that has raised creators over $100MM to date.

project.name: Zwiq: a High-Performance Athletic Water Bottle
project.description: a stainless steel water bottle that instantly clicks open and closed ‚Äî seamlessly.

creator.name: Zwigs
creator.biography: Zwigs is a content creator, product designer, athlete, and all-around solid guy.

texte: Zwiq is a stainless-steel water bottle built for speed and simplicity ‚Äî for moments when every second matters.
Designed for athletes and doers who want performance without friction, Zwiq delivers the best of both worlds in a beautifully simplistic fashion.
Its spring-powered cap opens and closes with an effortless click of the finger ‚Äî while the double-walled stainless-steel body keeps water tasting fresh and ice-cold for 24+ hours.
So whether you‚Äôre about to collapse mid-workout or just want a quick sip, ice-cold water is always a just click away.
Hi, my name is Matt, but the internet knows me as Zwigs.

That's my college nickname, where I first had the idea for Zwiq‚Ä¶ while pushing myself to the brink of exhaustion in a pool at 6 o‚Äôclock in the morning. (I competed for the University‚Äôs swim team.
Every day, in between laps at practice ‚Äî desperate for water ‚Äî I would frantically attempt to unscrew my clunky steel water bottle.

I would get to drink almost half a sip of water before my coach would ‚Äúencouragingly‚Äù scream in my face to "keep it moving". Many of my teammates avoided this by using squeezable plastic bottles... which are fast and convenient.
I‚Äôd rather drink the pool water instead of the warm, un-insulated, chemical-flavored water that comes out of plastic bottles.

So I set out to create a water bottle that was the best of both worlds ‚Äî a stainless steel insulated water bottle that could be opened and closed just as fast as a squeezable plastic bottle. I documented the entire design process on YouTube, under the name Zwigs.
Today - over three years later - I have done it.
A stainless steel bottle that clicks open and closed instantly - equipped with a host of other thoughtfully engineered features.
One click to open, one click to close.
Fast ‚Äì convenient ‚Äì secure.
Sleekly folding giant handle ‚Äî there when you need it, invisible when you don‚Äôt.
Lock the bottle with a simple twist, ensuring the bottle does not accidentally spring open during transit.

An optional extra layer of protection for travel purposes. Platinum silicone topper flawlessly protects the nozzle from dirt and grime. It tethers securely to the top of the bottle while staying out of the way when you don‚Äôt need it.
Zwiq‚Äôs water bottle body is made from double-walled 304 kitchen-grade stainless steel, with a cap designed with insulation in mind ‚Äî keeping your drink cold, even in the hottest environments.
This timeline encapsulates the egregiously long time it took me to make Zwiq perfect and ready for you!
Those are the highlights! If you want a more in-depth look at the journey, check out my YouTube channel here
Backers will choose their color(s) after the campaign ends, with blue, white, and purple colors potentially being unlocked if funding goals are hit!
*any color includes the Limited Edition Color

Your support goes toward materials and fulfillment for the first-ever production run of Zwiq! This first run establishes production to take Zwiq from a Prototype designed for manufacturing to real product.
Zwiq carries 32 ounces of water
Zwiq's spring-powered mechanism is made from 304 Stainless Steel.
Zwiq is manufactured without lead-containing materials, prioritizing safety from the start.
To keep things fair and accurate, shipping will be charged after the campaign ends, once production is complete and your bottle is ready to ship.
Why?

Because real-world shipping costs depend on several factors ‚Äî including your location, current carrier rates, trade policies, tariff regulations and how many bottles you order. Rather than guessing now and padding the numbers, we want to charge the actual cost of shipping, not an estimate.
So how does it work?
We will not profit from shipping. Our goal is simply to get your bottle to you as efficiently and affordably as possible.
We‚Äôll provide clear updates throughout production and fulfillment so you always know what to expect.

project.name: Never-clean Cat Litter Box
project.description: Kat Kolosseum

creator.name: John O'Connell
creator.biography: John O'Connell is a Professional Environmental Engineer (Chemical) from Canada.  John has over 10 process patents in the field of sulfur recovery and hydrogen production.  John is an animal lover and has/had inumerables pets: cats, dogs, birds, and lizards.

texte: Never-clean Kat Kolosseum (Patent Pending)
Introduction

After 30+ years of using different types of cat litter boxes, I grew tired of having to clean boxes, scoops, machines, and machine parts.  I decided that I would attempt to design a new cat litter box, that as a minimum, I would only have to clean on an infrequent basis.  However, as my design began to take shape, I realized that if I incorporate multiple specific objectives, and that these objectives can be met, the end result will be a cat litter unit that NEVER needs to be cleaned (not including removal of excrement).

The single over-riding objective that must be met in order to be able to claim a ‚Äònever-clean‚Äô status, is that the feline must not be able to reach any of the supporting structure of the new litter box (i.e. feline only has access to litter).
A subset of objectives (claims) that will support the main objective are as follows:
1.   Many cats love the corners of their litter box.  So, we remove the corners!  In other words, the new design must be round.
2.   Many cats love to dig down to the bottom of the litter box.  To minimize the possibility of reaching the bottom, we design the litter box to be deep.
3.   How do we keep the cats away from the sides of the litter box?  We restrict their movement!  The lid of the new design is round with a hole in the center, like a donut!

4.   How do we simplify the removal of urine clumps and feces?  We incorporate a sifting mechanism in the new design.  This allows all clean litter to be fully recovered, each time the owner removes cat excrement.

5.   How do we replace the sifting section without having to transfer all the remaining clean litter, and creating significant dust in the process?  A bowl-shaped sifting basket has been included in the new design that ‚Äòslips under‚Äô the remaining clean litter, which does not produce any dust.
Drawings and photos of the final prototype of the new design are as follows:

The hole in the middle of the lid is large enough for even large cats to conduct their business in comfort!  The sifting basket has two handles to allow for removal of excrement, placing clumps and feces into a bag or collection container.  Replacement of the basket is a simple process of sliding it under the clean litter in the bottom section of the litter box (please review video).  The unit must be tilted and leveled several times to allow all the litter to be level in the basket before the lid is replaced.  (A small price to pay for a litter box that never needs cleaning!)
Once every week or two, fresh litter can be added to replace the small amount that is used during the clumping of urine.

The new design is sleek and modern looking, and will be made available in several different pastel colors.  The Kat Kolosseum will be made of exceptionally durable and safe plastic to protect your beautiful felines!  They will enjoy using their new litter box as it gives them real satisfaction with respect to their natural desire to first dig, and then bury their business!
Please review the following video that includes the Kat Kolosseum in action!
Timeline
The final prototype has been created, via 3-D printed file, and we are now ready to move into the production phase.

Only three separate injection molds are required for the production of the Kat Kolosseum, and a very experienced production facility in Vietnam has been sourced.  Upon completion of the injection molds, followed by a brief final testing phase, production can begin.
Since all preliminary proto-typing and major testing programs have already been completed, raised funds will be used to create the injection molds, and for final testing.
Due to the simplicity of the injection molds, very large production rates can be achieved in a short period of time.
Rewards
The expected retail price for the Kat Kolosseum is $99 USD.
Early-bird rewards (pledge of $49 USD) will include a maximum of one Kat Kolosseum.
Second tier rewards (pledge of $110 USD) will include two Kat Kolosseums.
Third tier reward (pledge of $70 USD) will include a maximum of one Kat Kolosseum.
Fourth tier reward (pledge of $150 USD) will include two Kat Kolosseums.
Risks
Due to the extraordinary simplicity of the new design, and zero risks associated with the injection mold procedures, project risk is at a minimum.

project.name: Cool Snap
project.description: On-demand cooling for life on the move.

creator.name: Sam Cantu
creator.biography: I'm Sam Cantu, a wine specialist at large alcohol retailer with a deep passion for innovation in the beverage world. As a first-generation American with roots in Mexico and Trinidad, I've always been driven to bring people together over exceptional drinks. With my startup, Cool Snap, I‚Äôm on a mission to revolutionize the way we enjoy perfectly chilled beverages‚Äîanytime, anywhere.

texte: Cool Snap
Chill your drink anywhere ‚Äî no ice, no outlets.
I‚Äôm Sam Cantu, a wine specialist in the beverage industry. I‚Äôve spent years helping people enjoy wine at its best ‚Äî and nothing ruins a great bottle faster than the wrong temperature.
Whether you‚Äôre at the beach, camping, tailgating, or hosting friends, there isn‚Äôt always ice or refrigeration available.
So I built a solution.
What Is Cool Snap?
Cool Snap is a patent-pending, single-use cooling sleeve that rapidly lowers your beverage temperature ‚Äî anytime, anywhere.
Activate it.
Slip it on.
Let the cooling begin.
In controlled testing at approximately 71¬∞F room temperature, Cool Snap reduced a beverage to 43¬∞F in just 7 minutes and maintained temperatures under 50¬∞F for several minutes.
No electricity.
No freezer.
No waiting around.
Proof It Works
We‚Äôve built working prototypes and conducted repeat testing to validate performance.
You‚Äôll see:
‚Ä¢ Real prototype photos
‚Ä¢ A full, unedited demo video
‚Ä¢ Transparent performance data
This is not a concept sketch ‚Äî it‚Äôs a functioning product moving toward production.
Where We Are Now
‚Ä¢ Working prototypes complete
‚Ä¢ Patent protection filed
‚Ä¢ Manufacturing discussions underway
‚Ä¢ Initial cost modeling completed
Your support funds:
‚Ä¢ Final tooling
‚Ä¢ Production setup
‚Ä¢ Packaging refinement
‚Ä¢ First manufacturing run
This campaign bridges prototype to production.
Why It Matters
Cool Snap isn‚Äôt just about wine.
It‚Äôs about:
‚Ä¢ Outdoor freedom
‚Ä¢ Spontaneous moments
‚Ä¢ Entertaining without stress
‚Ä¢ Convenience without bulky coolers
It solves a simple but universal frustration.
Why Back Now?
This is the earliest stage to be part of Cool Snap.
By backing now, you‚Äôre helping:
‚Ä¢ Move from prototype to mass production
‚Ä¢ Lock in first-batch pricing
‚Ä¢ Bring a patent-protected product to market
Once funded, production begins immediately.
A Personal Note
Getting this funded would be life-changing ‚Äî not just for me, but for my family. This campaign represents years of refining ideas, testing prototypes, and pushing through setbacks.
Cool Snap works.
Now it‚Äôs time to bring it to the world.

Below, just like the main image, is an AI-generated mock-up of what we envision the final product will look like. The design may evolve as we refine materials and packaging, but this gives a great feel for where we're headed! I designed the logo myself, so this concept really reflects both the product and the brand we‚Äôre building.

project.name: The Story of the Himalayan Notebook
project.description: A Journey into Nepal‚Äôs Lokta Paper Heritage

creator.name: Bigyan Acharya
creator.biography: I am an artist

texte: The Story of the Himalayan Notebook
A Journey into Nepal‚Äôs Lokta Paper Heritage

Thanks to all backers for kind support. We are very happy to do this campaign and will have supports from worldwide. We will deliver products only after ends of projects. We prioritize delivery with product from 5 USD as digital copy and pdf all delivery 10 USD and physical products at 18 USD. We I‚Äôll deliver with delivery charges but some places of course not then we will add delivery charges at 10 USD.
You can email us : bigyan500@gmail.com
You can write on every page and it‚Äôs designed with best pictures of Nepal

High in the hills of Nepal, where mist moves slowly across terraced mountains and prayer flags flutter between ancient temples, a quiet craft has survived for more than a thousand years. That craft is the making of handmade Nepali paper from the bark of the Lokta plant ‚Äî a tradition that lives on today in beautiful, durable notebooks.
This is the story of the Lokta paper notebook ‚Äî its history, how it is made, why it is special, and how it can travel from Nepal to the world through a thoughtful and well-managed campaign.
1. What Is Lokta Paper?

Lokta paper is traditional handmade paper crafted in Nepal from the bark of the Daphne plant (Daphne bholua and Daphne papyracea), which grows naturally in the Himalayan forests at altitudes of 1,600 to 4,000 meters.
The plant regenerates after harvesting, making it one of the most sustainable paper sources in the world.
In Nepali, handmade paper is known as ‚ÄúNepali Kagaz.‚Äù
2. A Short History of Lokta Paper
Lokta paper production dates back over 1,000 years. It was traditionally used for:
Many ancient documents written on Lokta paper are still preserved today because of its durability and resistance to insects and humidity.
Historically, the craft was centered in rural Himalayan districts such as Baglung, Parbat, and Myagdi. Later, production hubs developed around Kathmandu for finishing and export.
For centuries, Lokta paper remained mostly within Nepal because it was used for official and religious purposes. It was not mass-produced or industrialized like Western wood-pulp paper.
3. Why Is Lokta Paper Unique?
1. Strong and Durable
Lokta paper is tear-resistant and long-lasting.
2. Naturally Insect Resistant
The fibers naturally resist termites and insects.
3. Eco-Friendly
The Daphne plant regenerates after harvesting, and the paper is made without harsh chemicals.
4. Acid-Free
It does not turn yellow quickly like industrial paper.
5. Handmade Texture
Each sheet has slight variations, giving character and authenticity.
4. How Lokta Paper Is Made
The process is entirely handcrafted:
Step 1: Harvesting
Local villagers carefully cut the bark of mature Daphne plants. The root system remains intact so the plant regrows.
Step 2: Soaking and Boiling
The bark is soaked and boiled with water and natural soda ash to soften fibers.
Step 3: Beating
The softened bark is beaten into pulp using wooden mallets.
Step 4: Pulp Mixing
The pulp is mixed with water to create a slurry.
Step 5: Sheet Formation
A wooden frame with fine mesh is dipped into the slurry. The pulp spreads evenly.
Step 6: Sun Drying
The sheet dries naturally in the sun.
Step 7: Finishing
Sheets may be pressed, dyed naturally, screen-printed, or left raw.
The entire process is low energy and environmentally friendly.
5. Ingredients Used
Lokta paper typically contains:
No wood pulp. No industrial bleach. No plastic.
6. The Lokta Notebook Concept
A Lokta paper notebook combines traditional paper sheets with modern binding and design.
Possible Sizes
Page Options
Unique Feature Idea
Each page background contains a faint Nepali image such as:
This creates a cultural experience inside every notebook.
7. What Can Lokta Notebooks Be Used For?
Artists especially love Lokta paper because it works well with ink, pencil, and light watercolor.
8. Why Has Lokta Paper Not Dominated Worldwide?
Several reasons:
1. Limited Production Scale
It is handmade, not industrial. Production volume is lower.
2. Remote Geography
Raw material grows in mountainous areas.
3. Lack of Global Branding
Nepal has not heavily marketed Lokta paper internationally compared to Japanese washi or Italian paper.
4. Export Logistics
Small producers often lack international distribution networks.
5. Cost Compared to Industrial Paper
Mass-produced paper is cheaper.
However, in today‚Äôs eco-conscious market, Lokta paper has strong potential.
9. Production Costs (Approximate Example)
Costs vary depending on quality and quantity.
Estimated example for A5 notebook:

Retail price internationally:
$18 depending on branding with courier.
10. Benefits of Lokta Notebooks
Environmental Benefits
Social Benefits
Consumer Benefits
11. Reliability of Supply
Lokta plants regenerate within 5‚Äì7 years. Nepal has regulated harvesting to protect forests.
Reliable production depends on:
Building relationships with trusted suppliers is key.
12. Risks and Challenges
Production Delays
Handmade process may slow during monsoon.
Quality Variation
Each batch may vary slightly.
Shipping Costs
International delivery may fluctuate.
Customs Delays
Even paper products may be inspected.
Currency Exchange Fluctuation
International pricing risks.
13. Worldwide Delivery Plan
Shipping Options

14. When to Contact the Seller
Contact your supplier:
Maintain written agreements and clear timelines.
15. What If Item Is Not Delivered?
If parcel is lost:
Always plan 5‚Äì10% extra production.
16. What If Backer Gives Wrong Address?
Policy suggestion:
17. What If Delivery Is Impossible?
If country restrictions occur:
18. What If Backer Changes Mind After Campaign Success?
On Kickstarter-style platforms:
Clear refund policy must be written in campaign page.
19. Customer Satisfaction Strategy
To reduce complaints:
20. The Emotional Story
A Lokta notebook is not just paper.
It carries:
When someone writes inside it, they connect with a living tradition.
21. Long-Term Vision
Start with:
Then expand into:
22. Why Choose Nepal‚Äôs Lokta Paper?
Because it is:

Authentic
Sustainable
Cultural
Handmade
Meaningful
In a world full of machine-made products, a Lokta notebook offers human touch.
Conclusion
The Lokta paper notebook is a bridge between Himalayan heritage and modern creativity. It represents sustainability, resilience, and craftsmanship.
With proper planning, transparent policies, careful supplier selection, and strong storytelling, it can become a successful worldwide product.
It is light to ship, rich in culture, and powerful in purpose.
From the mountains of Nepal to desks around the world ‚Äî every page tells a story.

project.name: Hallow & Hearth‚Ñ¢: Luxury Candles for Intentional Evenings
project.description: A luxury candle collection for intentional evenings, centered on scent, sound, and atmosphere.

creator.name: Susan States
creator.biography: Susan States is the founder of Hallow & Hearth‚Ñ¢, a mood-driven candle brand focused on intentional atmosphere, quality, and everyday rituals. She is also a nurse based in Oklahoma City.

texte: Hallow & Hearth‚Ñ¢
The Experience
Hallow & Hearth‚Ñ¢ candles are crafted for intentional evenings, with a focus on scent and atmosphere.
Each candle is part of a broader evening ritual, with curated atmosphere and optional soundscapes shared with our community.
This collection is for those who value restraint, quality, and the quiet luxury of choosing how a space feels.
What‚Äôs Included
Each Wickedly Hot‚Ñ¢ candle is a full-size, hand-poured candle finished with luxury packaging and care details to complete the experience.
Exact candle selections will be made after the campaign via a backer survey.
Made With Care

Every Hallow & Hearth‚Ñ¢ candle is made with a soy-based wax blend and thoughtfully chosen ingredients. Our candles are vegan, and our fragrances are free from phthalates and parabens. We focus on high-quality materials and careful formulation so you can enjoy the experience with confidence‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre winding down for the evening or curating a quiet moment at home.
What you can expect
Soy-based wax blend
Vegan
Phthalate-free and paraben-free fragrances
Designed for a clean, enjoyable burn
Meet the three candles that make up the Wickedly Hot‚Ñ¢ collection. Each one is designed around a distinct mood‚Äîhere‚Äôs how they each come to life.
Golden Glow, Wicked Slow‚Ñ¢

Golden Glow, Wicked Slow‚Ñ¢ is your everyday luxury candle‚Äîthe one you light when you want the evening to feel more intentional. Warm, inviting, and easy to live with, it‚Äôs made for quiet moments with a book, slow conversations, or an unhurried end to the day. This is the candle that turns ‚Äújust another night‚Äù into a small ritual you look forward to.
Soft Calm, Wicked Charm‚Ñ¢

Soft Calm, Wicked Charm‚Ñ¢ is centered on rest, reset, and gentle indulgence. It‚Äôs made for bath nights, evening rituals, and moments when you want your space to feel serene and considered. Light this when you‚Äôre ready to step into a quieter, more intentional atmosphere and let the room set the tone.
Dark Heat, Wicked Sweet‚Ñ¢

Dark Heat, Wicked Sweet‚Ñ¢ is your deeper, moodier evening candle. Warm, rich, and a little indulgent, it‚Äôs designed for slow nights, late conversations, and setting a more intimate, atmospheric tone. This is the candle you reach for when you want the room to feel cozy, grounded, and just a little bit sultry.
How It Works
1.Choose your reward tier and place your pledge during the campaign.
2. After the campaign ends, you‚Äôll receive a backer survey to select your candle(s) and confirm your shipping details.
3. Candles are produced after funding is complete, with careful attention to quality and packaging.
4. Orders ship once production is finished.
Timeline
Campaign: February 18 ‚Äì March 10, 2026
Backer surveys sent: March 2026
Production begins: Late March 2026
Orders ship: April 2026 (after Easter)
Fulfillment & Shipping

All candles are produced after the campaign is successfully funded.
Shipping is available within the United States only.
Shipping costs will be charged after the campaign through the backer survey, once rewards are ready to ship.
Risks & Challenges

This project involves the production and fulfillment of physical goods. While timelines may shift slightly due to manufacturing or shipping factors, every effort will be made to communicate clearly and deliver rewards as planned.

Health and Wellness Product Disclaimer: This project and its rewards are not a replacement for medication, medical treatment, or a doctor's examination. Kickstarter does not endorse or verify the veracity of any claims made on project pages, and is not responsible for any opinion, advice, information, or statements made by third parties, including creators. Projects on Kickstarter do not claim to diagnose, treat, or cure any medical condition. The Creator is solely responsible for complying with industry standards and applicable laws, including product safety standards.
About the Creator
Hi, I‚Äôm Susan States, founder of Hallow & Hearth‚Ñ¢. Alongside my work as a nurse, I‚Äôve been building this brand around the idea that atmosphere is something you choose intentionally.

Hallow & Hearth‚Ñ¢ creates mood-driven candles designed to shape how a space feels and how a moment unfolds. This Kickstarter is the first step in bringing that vision to life with the level of care and quality it deserves.

project.name: "Oben Ohne" - magazine project from design students
project.description: Rauchapause, No Pressure, Mischkonsum - a visual dispute with the topic "Unvernunft" from three different perspectives

creator.name: Seit.Hannah
creator.biography:
Heyo lovely people!
I‚Äôm Hannah, currently in my fifth semester at the Academy of Illustration and Design in Berlin, and together with my semester, I‚Äôm working on a magazine right now. :)

texte: Liebe bunte Menschen, kreativliebende, staunende, neugierige, forschende Denker...
‚ú®  üí°  üîé  üíõ  üí≠

WIR, 15 aufstrebende Illustrator:innen der AID Berlin, wollen mit Euch unser gro√ües Magazinprojekt ins Leben rufen!

Seit Monaten entwickeln wir bereits hinter den Kulissen ‚ÄûOben Ohne"- eine Magazinstrecke, die es den Leser:innen m√∂glich macht die Seiten der Unvernunft zu entbl√§ttern.

Drei Magazine, drei unterschiedliche Perspektiven, ein gro√ües Thema.

Was ist das eigentlich Unvernunft?ü§î
Wie viele Facetten der Unvernunft gibt es zu entdecken?üëÄ

Wir wollen dazugeh√∂ren und uns dennoch entfalten.ü¶ã 
Wir wollen tr√§umen, aber auch realistisch bleiben.üåù 
Dabei stehen wir oft unter Druck und sp√ºren Gegens√§tze in uns aufsteigen.

Das Magazin ‚ÄûNo Pressure" erz√§hlt aus eigenen Erfahrungen und Beobachtungen, in wie vielen unterschiedlichen Lebensreichen sich Unvernunft im Gewand des Alltages versteckt.üò∂‚Äçüå´Ô∏è

Das Magazin ‚ÄûRauchapause" will am liebsten einfach mal auf die Pausetaste dr√ºcken und sich in Tr√§umereien und unvern√ºnftigen Gewohnheiten fl√ºchten.‚èØÔ∏è

Das Magazin ‚ÄûMischkonsum" will keine Regeln und Grenzen setzen, sondern schlummerndes Unvernunft-Potenzial in uns wecken.ü´ß

Alle Hefte vereint eines, dass wir uns selbst hinterfragen und Einblicke in unser Leben geben. Mit vielf√§ltigen Illustrationen werden die Artikel nicht nur mit Worten, sondern besonders stark mit unseren Bildwelten erz√§hlt.

Wir wollen euch einladen mit uns in jene Bildwelten abzutauchen und freuen uns sehr √ºber Eure finanzielle Unterst√ºtzung.

Wir brauchen 1.500 Euro f√ºr die Produktion unserer kleinen Magazinstrecken-Auflage.

Das Ganze wird voraussichtlich im M√§rz gedruckt, wenn wir gen√ºgend Unterst√ºtzer:innen finden.

Wir freuen uns √ºber jeden, der uns jungen Kreativschaffenden die M√∂glichkeit gibt, so ein gro√ües Projekt mit Leidenschaft umzusetzen und hoffentlich bald den Duft von frischbedrucktem Papier in den H√§nden zu halten.
English Version:
Dear colourful souls, lovers of creativity, wonderers, curious minds, and inquisitive thinkers‚Ä¶
We, 15 emerging illustrators from AID Berlin want to bring our major magazine project to life together with you!

For months now, we‚Äôve been working behind the scenes on ‚ÄúOben Ohne‚Äù, a magazine series that invites readers to peel back the pages of Unvernunft. Three magazines, three different perspectives, one shared theme. What is Unvernunft, really?
How many facets of Unvernunft are there to discover? We want to belong, yet still unfold. We want to dream, but also stay realistic. Along the way, we often feel pressure and sense contradictions rising within us.

The magazine ‚ÄúNo Pressure‚Äù draws from personal experiences and observations to explore the many areas of life where Unvernunft hides in the clothing of everyday routines. 
The magazine ‚ÄúRauchapause‚Äù longs to hit the pause button, drifting into daydreams and delightfully unvern√ºnftige habits. 
The magazine ‚ÄúMischkonsum‚Äù refuses to set rules or boundaries, instead awakening the dormant potential for Unvernunft within us.

All three issues share one thing: we question ourselves and offer glimpses into our lives. Through a wide range of illustrations, the articles are told not only through words, but powerfully through our visual worlds.
We invite you to dive into these visual worlds with us and we are deeply grateful for your financial support.

We need ‚Ç¨1,500 to produce our small magazine print run. Printing is planned for March, provided we find enough supporters. We appreciate everyone who gives us young creatives the opportunity to bring such a passionate project to life and hopefully soon hold the scent of freshly printed pages in our hands.

English subtitels for the video:
Hey guys,
I'm Kaya from the 5th semester of the Akademie for Illustration und Design Berlin.
We currently work on a collaborative magazine project about our topic "Unvernunft" (translates to irrationality, unreasonability)
In three different editions we address serious topics such as society criticism as well as foolish nonsense from our everyday life. To fulfill our goal, we opened an Instagram account where you can watch behind the scenes moment or follow our progress. We also opened a Kickstarter campaign, opening the possibility for those who want to financially support us. If we were able to make you interested, we'd be very glad if you'd take a look! Thank you very much!
